Last year, we launched The Trio of Time, a collaboration where we visit three different cities around the globe to partner with local designers and explore their perception of time.

 

We're thrilled to introduce our newest collaboration—""Order""—a timepiece inspired by New York City.
column2: >Order comes in a white, red, or black watchface.
column3: >The second edition of the Trio of Time, Order reframes our perception of time.
column5: >The simple design is made of a perforated watchface with a dot for each hour.
column7: >Small grooves on the watch's frame line up in 15 minute increments.
column9: >The Swiss ronda caliber movement allows for incredibly smooth spinning—you won't even notice the movement.
column12: >All watch straps are interchangeable, for the perfect look to fit your mood or outfit.
column14: >Order—BLUE with black leather strap.
column16: >Order—RED with black leather strap.
column18: >Order—WHITE with silver Milanese mesh bracelet.
column20: >Order—BLACK with black Milanese mesh bracelet.
column22: >Order watches fit any size wrist.
column24: >The modern design is an instant classic.
column26: >Inspired by the fast pace of NYC and the iconic NYCTA Subway signage.
column27:
> 

How to read the time

Order has no watch hands. Instead, the entire watchface is perforated with an ascending number of dots, which rotate to align with the frame and tell the time in 15 minute intervals. 

The designers hope to inspire the wearer to not worry so much about the exact time
column28: instead, to focus on the world around them.

column1: • The 40mm case is designed for both men and women.
• Order runs on a Ronda 512 Swiss Parts Movement.
• The watch has a 316L stainless-steel enclosed casing, available in black or silver.
• All straps are interchangeable with TTT#1—Hidden Time Watch—thanks to the smart docking system.

Creating Order 

For the Order watch, we partnered with graphic designers Hamish Smyth and Jesse Reedfrom their design office of the same name, Order.
column2:
>Order compliments the NYCTA Graphics Standards Manual.

 

Hamish and Jesse met while working at Pentagram under Michael Bierut, where they launched many well-known design projects, such as the Mastercard rebrand and the Hillary for America presidential logo. While at Pentagram, they started their independent publishing imprint Standards Manual, beginning with the reissue of the NYCTA Graphics Standards Manual.
column4:
>The duo working on the NYCTA Standards Manual.

 

Over the next couple years, they also reissued the NASA and EPA Graphics Standards Manuals on Kickstarter—raising over $2 million combined—along with self-publishing four other titles. Following their departure from Pentagram, the duo opened the only bookstore in New York specializing in graphic design. It sits right in front of their design office, Order.
column5:
>The Standards Manual shop in Greenpoint, Brooklyn.

 

Hamish and Jesse’s work with the NYCTA Graphics Standards Manual inspired their design for the watch, where they focused on representing time in a simple, graphic form. As the face rotates, the perforated dots reveal the hour indicated by an alignment with the frame. The wearer is then able to conceive time as a series of ordered dots that multiply as the day progresses, allowing for a new perception of time.
column6: >Circular icons in the NYC Subway signage.
column17: >Early order sketches and ideas.
column25:
> 

Smart docking system

Straps are available in white or black leather, or silver or black Milanese mesh (you will choose during the survey process).

Order comes with an interchangeable strap system that secures straps with a simple pull and click within seconds. You can find out more about our straps from our Hidden Time campaign.
column26: >The smart docking system allows for easy strap swaps.
column30: >Each TTT edition comes in unique packaging designed especially for the collaboration.
column32: >The watch also comes with a limited edition collector's plaque.
column34: >Packaging design for Order and Hidden Time.
column35:
> 

About The Trio of Time
column36: >The Series 000, Series K452, Hidden Time, and Order watches from Anicorn.
column37:
> 

Through The Trio of Time, we have the privilege of collaborating with local designers from incredible cities around the world. Together, we create a unique timepiece and bring our story to Kickstarter, where backers then help us bring the project to life, and choose our next destination.
column39: >The watch and strap combinations between Hidden Time and Order are endless.
column41:
>

In 2017, we began in Seoul with Korean designer Jiwoong Jung, who designed the first timepiece of the series, Hidden Time. The campaign was successfully funded within 48 hours from more than 2,000 backers worldwide.
column42: >Order expands our vision to challenge the perceptions of time.
column45: >The first edition of the Trio of Time, Hidden Time.
column47:
> 

We're really excited to be launching this second edition in New York City—the destination our backers chose from the first TTT campaign. If Order is a success, you will help us choose our next stop on this journey!

 

 

 

Why Indiegogo? 

Kickstarter has allowed us to not only bring our timepieces to life, but also establish our business. Most importantly, it has gifted us with a strong community that supports the work we do. 

We are deeply humbled by your support, and we can't wait to keep bringing you exciting projects.
column49: >Order's watchface is just the right size for wrists small and large.
column52: >Your support will help us make Order a reality.
column55: >After successful funding, you'll help us decide on our next city to visit.
column57: >Anicorn's The Trio of Time will then collaborate with a new designer, in a new city, to tell a new story.
column60: >Join us on our journey to complete The Trio of Time.
column61:
> 

Risks and challenges

We know there are always risks with production, but with our extensive experience we are confident we can get our watches out to you on time. We’ve learned about manufacturing and fulfillment from our three previous campaigns, and if we face any issues, we will be completely transparent and keep everyone updated on our progress.

As always, communication is key for us! We will share any and all developments during manufacturing and beyond.
column64:
> 

","FastCompany / Abduzeedo / Highsnobiety / MasterHorologer / GESSATO / Minimalissimo / Chaussures de Cool / Cool Tech HD / Geeky Gadgets / Trend Hunter Last year, we launched The Trio of Time, a collaboration where we visit three different cities around the globe to partner with local designers and explore their perception of time. We're thrilled to introduce our newest collaboration—""Order""—a timepiece inspired by New York City. Order comes in a white, red, or black watchface.The second edition of the Trio of Time, Order reframes our perception of time.The simple design is made of a perforated watchface with a dot for each hour.Small grooves on the watch's frame line up in 15 minute increments.The Swiss ronda caliber movement allows for incredibly smooth spinning—you won't even notice the movement. All watch straps are interchangeable, for the perfect look to fit your mood or outfit. Order—BLUE with black leather strap.  Order—RED with black leather strap.Order—WHITE with silver Milanese mesh bracelet.Order—BLACK with black Milanese mesh bracelet.Order watches fit any size wrist.The modern design is an instant classic.Inspired by the fast pace of NYC and the iconic NYCTA Subway signage. How to read the timeOrder has no watch hands. Instead, the entire watchface is perforated with an ascending number of dots, which rotate to align with the frame and tell the time in 15 minute intervals. The designers hope to inspire the wearer to not worry so much about the exact time
column65: instead, to focus on the world around them.

column1: The 40mm case is designed for both men and women.
Order runs on a Ronda 512 Swiss Parts Movement.
The watch has a 316L stainless-steel enclosed casing, available in black or silver.
All straps are interchangeable with TTT#1—Hidden Time Watch—thanks to the smart docking system.

Creating Order For the Order watch, we partnered with graphic designers Hamish Smyth and Jesse Reedfrom their design office of the same name, Order.Order compliments the NYCTA Graphics Standards Manual. Hamish and Jesse met while working at Pentagram under Michael Bierut, where they launched many well-known design projects, such as the Mastercard rebrand and the Hillary for America presidential logo. While at Pentagram, they started their independent publishing imprint Standards Manual, beginning with the reissue of the NYCTA Graphics Standards Manual. The duo working on the NYCTA Standards Manual. Over the next couple years, they also reissued the NASA and EPA Graphics Standards Manuals on Kickstarter—raising over $2 million combined—along with self-publishing four other titles. Following their departure from Pentagram, the duo opened the only bookstore in New York specializing in graphic design. It sits right in front of their design office, Order.  The Standards Manual shop in Greenpoint, Brooklyn. Hamish and Jesse’s work with the NYCTA Graphics Standards Manual inspired their design for the watch, where they focused on representing time in a simple, graphic form. As the face rotates, the perforated dots reveal the hour indicated by an alignment with the frame. The wearer is then able to conceive time as a series of ordered dots that multiply as the day progresses, allowing for a new perception of time.Circular icons in the NYC Subway signage.        Early order sketches and ideas. Preliminary designs for Order. Developing the watchface. The 12-hour cycle.  Smart docking systemStraps are available in white or black leather, or silver or black Milanese mesh (you will choose during the survey process).Order comes with an interchangeable strap system that secures straps with a simple pull and click within seconds. You can find out more about our straps from our Hidden Time campaign. The smart docking system allows for easy strap swaps.   Each TTT edition comes in unique packaging designed especially for the collaboration.The watch also comes with a limited edition collector's plaque.Packaging design for Order and Hidden Time. About The Trio of Time The Series 000, Series K452, Hidden Time, and Order watches from Anicorn. Through The Trio of Time, we have the privilege of collaborating with local designers from incredible cities around the world. Together, we create a unique timepiece and bring our story to Kickstarter, where backers then help us bring the project to life, and choose our next destination. The watch and strap combinations between Hidden Time and Order are endless.  In 2017, we began in Seoul with Korean designer Jiwoong Jung, who designed the first timepiece of the series, Hidden Time. The campaign was successfully funded within 48 hours from more than 2,000 backers worldwide.Order expands our vision to challenge the perceptions of time. The first edition of the Trio of Time, Hidden Time.  We're really excited to be launching this second edition in New York City—the destination our backers chose from the first TTT campaign. If Order is a success, you will help us choose our next stop on this journey!   Why Indiegogo? Kickstarter has allowed us to not only bring our timepieces to life, but also establish our business. Most importantly, it has gifted us with a strong community that supports the work we do. We are deeply humbled by your support, and we can't wait to keep bringing you exciting projects. Order's watchface is just the right size for wrists small and large. Your support will help us make Order a reality. After successful funding, you'll help us decide on our next city to visit. Anicorn's The Trio of Time will then collaborate with a new designer, in a new city, to tell a new story. Join us on our journey to complete The Trio of Time. Risks and challengesWe know there are always risks with production, but with our extensive experience we are confident we can get our watches out to you on time. We’ve learned about manufacturing and fulfillment from our three previous campaigns, and if we face any issues, we will be completely transparent and keep everyone updated on our progress.As always, communication is key for us! We will share any and all developments during manufacturing and beyond.",40.0,6,"3 Campaigns

column4:
/>

DRIVEN BY PASSION


My name is Lee Treliving, I'm a 26 year old Entrepenuer from  Plymouth, UK. 

I have spent 6 and a half years working in the watch and jewellery industry, learning each day and growing more passionate about watches each day. 
My time spent in the industry has mainly been Watch focused and has accounted for quite a few Watch training sessions in London and Switzerland with brands such as Breitling, Omega, and Tag Heuer. 

In my time working with the Swiss Watch Industry and dealing with customers on a daily basis it became clear to me that there is a gap in the market for a new swiss watch brand that captured the passion of one the worlds most popular sports. 

The idea and designs of Beautiful Game Watches (BGW) has come from a pure passion for the Beautiful game that is Football ,which stems from when i was a little boy. Combined with my new found passion and admiration for the Swiss watch industry.
column9:
/>


Each design has a representation of Football and has been thought out and tweaked over the last 2 years to become final designs that I as a football fan and watch lover feel have the right combination of Luxury, Quality and Fashion.

BGW will feature the first watch to be able to time a full 90 Minute match with just a 45 minute timescale. Meaning the hand will have to move at half the speed of a normal hand. 

Each watch will feature:
- Sapphire Crystal Glass - virtually unscratchable, Just don't let a diamond touch it. 

- Surgical Steel Bracelet and cases - 316L, Hypoallergenic

- 2 year Guarantee - 

Watches will be a mix of Quartz movements and Automatic movements and will range in the price of £450 - £1500.

This project is the start of long exciting journey for myself and each and every person who invests in this project and the customers who purchase the watches once BGW has been launched. 

I 100% believe that BGW will be an extremely successful Swiss watch brand as it will capture the worlds love and passion for Football as well as the admiration of Swiss watch Lovers. Once BGW is up and running it will constantly be supporting charities to help improve Grassroot Football as well as Sport Relief and other thought out charities.

As someone who keeps and eye on football news everyday as well as what's new in the watch world. BGW is already running through my blood and i am determined to make sure Beautiful Game Watches becomes a front runner in the Swiss Watch Industry.
column14:
What You Get

This is the first stage of Funding for BGW, being a father of 3 working a full time job, I haven't been able raise the funds by myself. 

This initial funding of £12000 will allow my designs to be created by a Swiss watch manufacture to be factory ready. These designs will then be developed and produced over a 4 month period. I will ensure we will receive up to date news and pictures of the watches in development. This funding will also allow for Beautiful Game Watches to have a watch display featuring actual Goal posts made up as well as boxes and guarantee's produced. 


Once the watches are completed and movements have been fitted BGW will have its first 4 Watches fully functioning. These watches will then allow BGW to create a professional marketing campaign and also arrange meetings with watch buyers from major companies to put BGW into there windows. 


The perks that come with helping fund Beautiful Game Watches will be very personal from myself and I hope you will be able to tell how grateful I and BGW are to receive your contribution. 

Each perk will receive a personal Thank you E-mail from myself and constant updates on the production of BGW. It's the extra perks you get when you contribute just that little bit extra that really stand out. 

If BGW does not reach its goal then unfortunately this passion and dream of mine will be unable to be fulfilled. So i really hope you can feel the Passion, Vision and Determination that I have for BGW to succeed and join me on this journey. 

Beautiful Game Watches has been created and designed by a football fan and watch enthusiast for the football fans around the world who also admire Swiss Watches. 

More Than Just A Watch Brand

Beautiful Game watches will not be just a watch brand, BGW will actively be helping improve the Grassroot of football, to ensure the youth have every chance possible to showcase there skills and talents. This will be done by organising tournaments and also donating money to charities to help out where it is most needed. 

BGW will aim to become the official watch brand of the FA. This will give BGW unprecedented access to the entire football world which will allow the brand to contribute to every area of football and development through a variety of avenues. 

I understand that most projects on here have already got a working model of their chosen idea, unfortunately I have not been able to produce this myself due to working full time and providing for the family, but in the spare time I have had available I have been working non stop for the last 2 years designing BGW because of how passionate I am about the Brand. This has lead me to find a manufacturer who will produce the watches from scratch and are ready to do so as soon as the funding is complete. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can connect with Beautiful Game Watches and want to help but are unable to contribute then please feel free to help in any other way possible, 

Spread the word through social media. Local community.Maybe if you have connections with Football teams then let them know about BGW and lets make this brand, the brand for every football fan in the world. 

Follow us on Twitter @BGWatches 
                   Facebook: Beautiful Game Watches

Please spread the word as far and wide as possible and help make my dream....the worlds reality. 

A really big personal Thank you from myself for reading through BGW and I really hope this can be the start of a journey which you all will want to be part of. 

Kind Regards

Lee Treliving

column1:
Fundings are mainly aimed at finalizing the new design, and buying components in larger quantities to keep the final product price as low as possible.
That's why if we don't reach the objective no one will be charged and, unfortunately, no one will receive the perk. :-(
So please help us spread the word and make this project a success! :-)

With the full perks (kit or assembled) you will receive a fully functioning and final product, complete with all the required instructions to set it up in minutes.
The Custom Color perk gives you the exclusive right of choosing a beautifully colored case (red, green or yellow).
We currently support Gmail and use the Gmail labels to differentiate the various categories of messages. For example you could consider 5 different Gmail labels:

Each label corresponds to a different color of the main multicolor indicator (e.g. blue for Bank, green for Personals, purple for Social, cyan for Notifications).
The Specials category is indicated by the separate star-shaped, yellow indicator.
Or you may choose to use the category labels provided by Gmail to automatically filter messages:
The ""Starred"" messages have a dedicated star-shaped indicator:

In addition, the top multicolor indicator becomes red to notify you of problems with your Gmail account (like network issues, wrong password or other errors) and becomes yellow in case no information is received for some time (temporary warning sign).
The embedded blue LED (right side of the box) indicates the successfull cloud connection and the correct activity.
The pulsing (hidden under the cloud symbol) multicolor LED meaning is described on the Spark starting page and mainly provides network connection information.

column1: The prototypes have been up and running continuously for a few months so we are really confident of their stability and reliability. The case design is nearly definitive, we may need to make one or two finalizing steps for optimum results. Each case will be 3d printed in Europe. The assembly will be (home) made in Italy by hand for maximum quality (and some cost saving!).
The electronic part is based on the very well known and greatly supported Spark Core, which is a former very succesfully crowd-funded project.

We are also working on the software side to make it easier and compatible with any (IMAP) email server, rather than just your Gmail account. Also, we plan to improve the software to provide real time notifications (current update time is 45 seconds on average).
We will keep you up to date on this page, so you know what you can expect and which features and improvements we will be adding to this project. Also, your feedback will be very much appreciated!

Given the very low consumption of the E-mail Watch, you could use a USB battery (commonly used to recharge mobile phones) to power it for several hours (depending on the battery capacity, a work day duration is easily reachable).

You think you personally don't need the E-mail Watch or you prefer to invest your financial resources in other projects? No problem! Please just make sure you share this project page with your friends, collegues or anyone you think could be interested in knowing more about it. That's the crowd-sourcing, help us reach the crowds out there!

How many emails do you receive every day? More than 10?Or are you tired of continuously checking your mobile phone / tablet / pc, for that email you are waiting for? Then you will appreciate our E-mail Watch!
We found that of the many emails we receive, only a few require our immediate attention, some can just be read later and some are really non-urgent notifications.

So it would be nice if we could have a quick idea of the incoming emails just by giving a glance to something somewhere around you, without the need of turning on any other device, just to check if there's anything new. No screens to read, no screens to touch, just a quick glance, without loosing the attention to what you are doing.

So we created the E-mail Watch, a small (ca. 50x40x20mm), 3d printed, microUSB powered, beautifully LED illuminated, stand alone, Wi-Fi connected box!It features a total of 4 multicolor LEDs, each giving an easy and quick information about your inbox new messages (and you can customize it to receive any other sort of notifications!).
This project is open-source, all the code will be shared so you can
improve it or change its behavior to your needs and preferences!
What We Need & What You Get

We already have a few working prototypes currently in use, you can see one in the picture above. We are already refining the case design and we would like to improve the software behind it and make it even simpler to configure
column2: then, once up and running, its operation requires no knowledge or control at all!

With the full perks (kit or assembled) you will receive a fully functioning and final product, complete with all the required instructions to set it up in minutes.The Custom Color perk gives you the exclusive right of choosing a beautifully colored case (red, green or yellow).
We currently support Gmail and use the Gmail labels to differentiate the various categories of messages. For example you could consider 5 different Gmail labels:

Each label corresponds to a different color of the main multicolor indicator (e.g. blue for Bank, green for Personals, purple for Social, cyan for Notifications).The Specials category is indicated by the separate star-shaped, yellow indicator.
Or you may choose to use the category labels provided by Gmail to automatically filter messages:
The ""Starred"" messages have a dedicated star-shaped indicator:

In addition, the top multicolor indicator becomes red to notify you of problems with your Gmail account (like network issues, wrong password or other errors) and becomes yellow in case no information is received for some time (temporary warning sign).
The embedded blue LED (right side of the box) indicates the successfull cloud connection and the correct activity.
The pulsing (hidden under the cloud symbol) multicolor LED meaning is described on the Spark starting page and mainly provides network connection information.
To make all this work fine you have a few options:

Run a simple (Linux) shell script (provided by us) on an ""always on"" PC (or a network server) or for example a Raspberry Pi, to check emails and send appropriate commands to the E-mail Watch. Of course you could have a single PC doing the job (somewhere in the cloud) for multiple Gmail accounts and E-mail Watch devices (anywhere you have a WiFi internet access).
Create a free account on pythonanywhere.com and run our Bash script there, so you don't need to have your own server online... it's the cloud!
Use any online service like Zapier, IFTTT, or many others to create your own rules and activate the E-mail Watch notifications at your own preference (based on email, or any other available source).
Build your own web page (or simple browser bookmarks) where you manually set notifications for someone else anywhere on earth (where a Wi-Fi connection to the Internet is available!).
Here is an exemplary architecture of the system using a free account on pythonanywhere.com (case 2):

Since all the code is open source, you will be able to modify it if you would like to change any behavior. Also the hardware allows for some customizations (like changing LED colors or adding a light sensor, for example!).This project full technical details and preview code are also available on the following: Hackster page.

The prototypes have been up and running continuously for a few months so we are really confident of their stability and reliability. The case design is nearly definitive, we may need to make one or two finalizing steps for optimum results. Each case will be 3d printed in Europe. The assembly will be (home) made in Italy by hand for maximum quality (and some cost saving!).
The electronic part is based on the very well known and greatly supported Spark Core, which is a former very succesfully crowd-funded project.

We are also working on the software side to make it easier and compatible with any (IMAP) email server, rather than just your Gmail account. Also, we plan to improve the software to provide real time notifications (current update time is 45 seconds on average).
We will keep you up to date on this page, so you know what you can expect and which features and improvements we will be adding to this project. Also, your feedback will be very much appreciated!

Given the very low consumption of the E-mail Watch, you could use a USB battery (commonly used to recharge mobile phones) to power it for several hours (depending on the battery capacity, a work day duration is easily reachable).

You think you personally don't need the E-mail Watch or you prefer to invest your financial resources in other projects? No problem! Please just make sure you share this project page with your friends, collegues or anyone you think could be interested in knowing more about it. That's the crowd-sourcing, help us reach the crowds out there!

This page is for the humpback whale design. If you would like to order one of the other four limited edition designs, click the images at the bottom of this page:

 

Illustrator Jo Brown produces incredible artworks that showcase animal life from around the world. We have been following Jo Brown's artworks since we came across her unique style of drawings several years ago. Recently we reached out to Jo with the idea of producing new artworks based on underwater photographs of our favourite ocean animals from around the world.

Jo has created some incredible concept pieces that we are hoping to print in a limited production of 25 t-shirts through this campaign. If successful, we will continue to work with Jo to think up and release new designs.

Lets share Jo's artwork with the world and show people our passion for marine life whilst we're at it. Art isn't only to be admired on gallery walls - why not wear beautiful art on a hand printed, eco-friendly T-shirt!

How are the shirts eco friendly?

We've found a supplier of organic cotton T-shirts (free of plastic micro-fibres) produced using responsible social practices and renewable energy. The 'Earth Positive' T-shirts will be hand screen printed in Bristol, UK and shipped directly to you using as little plastic packaging as we can.

How do I make sure that  I get the right size and colour?

At the end of the campaign we'll send you a survey asking for which cut (M/F), colour (Black, white or grey) and size combination (see sizing chart below). 

Why run an Indiegogo campaign for T-shirts - why not do a bulk print and sell them individually?

Consumer clothing produces an incredible amount of waste, some of which ends up in our oceans. The global average consumption of textiles is around 13kg per person, per year. Along the production chain there can be negative effects from agricultural practices, emissions of chemicals and plastic micro-fibres, and poor working conditions in factories. It sounds unthinkable, but a large portion of the budget fashion produced every year never ends up being worn before it enters landfill.
column2: >10,000 discarded clothing items in Hugh’s War on Waste
column4:
>Derick Melander's artwork Tollens (2017).

We want to ensure that any T-shirts we get made have as positive an impact on the people and environment as possible. For this to work, we need them all to go on to a happy new owner, with none left unworn or discarded as 'fashion waste'. When they can be worn no longer we hope they can be donated, mended, up-cycled, or composted rather than discarded into landfill. This campaign can help us make this happen - and if you've read this and become a supporter, it's already working!

What if you get more than 25 T-shirt orders? Will you run out?

No, we won't run out - we won't take your money or print the shirts if we don't get 25 orders, but we would love to print more. If you're a supporter and we make or exceed our goal, you won't miss out on a shirt.

Where will our money go?

Most of the funding will go towards actually purchasing and printing the T-shirts, since this is a minimum run. About 40% of each shirt sale will go towards collaborating on the next set of commissioned artworks with Jo Brown.

If we exceed our initial goal of funding 25 shirts, the cost of printing begins to decrease. If we get more than 25 orders, we'll donate 2.5% of the proceeds to Oceana, a charity which campaigns for global Ocean Conservation at a community level. If we pass 100 shirts we will increase this to 5%
column6:
for 200 shirts, 10%, and so on to a maximum of 20% of the overall funding.

The shirts look awesome, I want to support the campaign, what size should I order?

Here's the sizing guide direct from the t-shirt supplier. We'll hopefully get some samples soon, so we can give you a guide against real people. Please note that due to the small print run and screen-printing method, the size of the printed artwork will not scale to the size of the shirt.

Click here to see the mantis shrimp t-shirt campaign. 

Click here to see the octopus t-shirt campaign. 

Click here to see the cuttlefish t-shirt campaign. 

Click here to see the leafy seadragon t-shirt campaign. 

 

","This page is for the humpback whale design. If you would like to order one of the other four limited edition designs, click the images at the bottom of this page: Illustrator Jo Brown produces incredible artworks that showcase animal life from around the world. We have been following Jo Brown's artworks since we came across her unique style of drawings several years ago. Recently we reached out to Jo with the idea of producing new artworks based on underwater photographs of our favourite ocean animals from around the world.Jo has created some incredible concept pieces that we are hoping to print in a limited production of 25 t-shirts through this campaign. If successful, we will continue to work with Jo to think up and release new designs.Lets share Jo's artwork with the world and show people our passion for marine life whilst we're at it. Art isn't only to be admired on gallery walls - why not wear beautiful art on a hand printed, eco-friendly T-shirt!How are the shirts eco friendly?We've found a supplier of organic cotton T-shirts (free of plastic micro-fibres) produced using responsible social practices and renewable energy. The 'Earth Positive' T-shirts will be hand screen printed in Bristol, UK and shipped directly to you using as little plastic packaging as we can.How do I make sure that  I get the right size and colour?At the end of the campaign we'll send you a survey asking for which cut (M/F), colour (Black, white or grey) and size combination (see sizing chart below). Why run an Indiegogo campaign for T-shirts - why not do a bulk print and sell them individually?Consumer clothing produces an incredible amount of waste, some of which ends up in our oceans. The global average consumption of textiles is around 13kg per person, per year. Along the production chain there can be negative effects from agricultural practices, emissions of chemicals and plastic micro-fibres, and poor working conditions in factories. It sounds unthinkable, but a large portion of the budget fashion produced every year never ends up being worn before it enters landfill.10,000 discarded clothing items in Hugh’s War on Waste
column7: Derick Melander's artwork Tollens (2017).We want to ensure that any T-shirts we get made have as positive an impact on the people and environment as possible. For this to work, we need them all to go on to a happy new owner, with none left unworn or discarded as 'fashion waste'. When they can be worn no longer we hope they can be donated, mended, up-cycled, or composted rather than discarded into landfill. This campaign can help us make this happen - and if you've read this and become a supporter, it's already working!What if you get more than 25 T-shirt orders? Will you run out?No, we won't run out - we won't take your money or print the shirts if we don't get 25 orders, but we would love to print more. If you're a supporter and we make or exceed our goal, you won't miss out on a shirt.Where will our money go?Most of the funding will go towards actually purchasing and printing the T-shirts, since this is a minimum run. About 40% of each shirt sale will go towards collaborating on the next set of commissioned artworks with Jo Brown.If we exceed our initial goal of funding 25 shirts, the cost of printing begins to decrease. If we get more than 25 orders, we'll donate 2.5% of the proceeds to Oceana, a charity which campaigns for global Ocean Conservation at a community level. If we pass 100 shirts we will increase this to 5%
column9: for 200 shirts, 10%, and so on to a maximum of 20% of the overall funding.The shirts look awesome, I want to support the campaign, what size should I order?Here's the sizing guide direct from the t-shirt supplier. We'll hopefully get some samples soon, so we can give you a guide against real people. Please note that due to the small print run and screen-printing method, the size of the printed artwork will not scale to the size of the shirt.Click here to see the mantis shrimp t-shirt campaign. Click here to see the octopus t-shirt campaign. Click here to see the cuttlefish t-shirt campaign. Click here to see the leafy seadragon t-shirt campaign.",12.0,0,"5 Campaigns

column1:
PLEASE READ EVERYTHING (Including SIZES)

WVU Mountain Momma PT II
The Shoes

West Virginia as a state is bonded by two things..... Blue and Gold.   They are a not just a fan base...but a large family base who supports those that support them.

I have learned quickly that my bride to be bleeds blue and gold and wanted her own pair of West Virginia kicks, so I thought.. why not make this offering to everyone who shares her passion.

For those who are reading this.  Welcome.   I am excited to provide this offering as I did market research on if this would be feasible and the feedback was overwhelming.  The first go around these had over 600 shares on Facebook in less than 5 days and inquiries on WHEN WILL THEY BE AVAILABLE!?!?!? 

This pre-sale will last exactly 3 days.  Those who purchased initially will not have their footwear delayed due to other's being late to the party.

To those who take this opportunity, I thank you in advance.

column2:
What You Get

There are future perks for WVU depending on the level of success of this project.

column1: • I am raising $15,000 which represents $5,000 for each color-way
• This is the minimum amount of sneakers I am able to get away with from the factory in order to provide you a great price.
• The price to you the WVU supporter is $65 + $10 flat shipping
• There will be no multi shoe discount as there was last time.
• There will be Men, Women and Kids shoes available for purchase.

• Kids (Toddler) shoes will be (Sizes 5T - 10T) 
    Juniors shoes will be priced (Sizes 12J - 4J)
    Women's shoes will be  (Sizes 6 - 11)
• SIZES WILL BE PICKED AFTER THE PRE_SALE IS DONE.  This is an Indiegogo thing,
Once the pre-sale is over, there is about a 14 day wait time from Indiegogo to receive the funds.

SIZES

 A Survey will be sent out after the funding is over to get sizes for you and your family.

These shoes are in production already, I am simply adding additional numbers for those who order by Saturday in order to get everyone their pairs by Football season. I will create a group page for all those who have purchased.

The Impact

Depending on the level of success for this project the WVU Family will be afforded several perks as well as help a small business grow and show it's loyalty to the base that was loyal to us.
• We will develop not only WVU specific footwear, but Hunting footwear and apparel for those who seem to already be interested in our HUNTSMAN line.
• We have already had one successful crowd fund project so this will keep things going and hopefully in the future allow us to put a loyalty store in West Virginia Locations.
• We are regular people trying to accomplish great things with the help of a great family and fan base.
• Since we have already had a successful project for three previous footwear items, we have our lessons learned and have already implemented it for this project.

• The biggest challenge we could encounter is going well over our target of $15,000 which means we will have a bigger support base and will be able to do alot more in providing great products for you not only as a WVU supporter but a consumer in general.

Other Ways You Can Help

While we understand everyone can't contribute, there are other ways you can support this project
• Share, Share, Share.  The best times to share this on your social networks is from 10am to 3pm when most folks are working goofing off! lol
• I have put together a status update in our Facebook group located here: https://www.facebook.com/groups/ALPHAKICKSTARTER
• There are also share tools on Indiegogo

What most don't talk about and won't do because it's not a priority is speak of community outreach and giving back to the communities that have supported you.

Via our Outreach arm Deep Hearts Nation we pledge to donate kicks and money to:

Many out there donate a portion of their proceeds but are never transparent on what that is.  Our aim is to give a pair of sneakers away to those in need for every pair we sell. 

We are not just about the awareness... but actually giving resources to those who need them.  Many organizations merely raise money to have another money raising event where those who are in need never see the resources they need. 

Here are links to the sites we have theme shoes for:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/DEEPHEARTSWORLDWIDE

For those interested in wholesaling these or any of our products in order to create business in your community and sales jobs or retail jobs, please contact us.  Without small businesses supporting one another none of survive.
With your help it can happen.  Thanks in advance for all your support.

It's our vision to make Task Coach even better

We are Martin (a product designer from Munich, Germany) and Vladimir (a developer from Kiew, Ukraine) and we want to get the ability to rearrange columns with drag and drop (a feature wanted by many other users ) into Task Coach.

We have teamed up with Frank Niessink, Jérôme Laheurte and Aaron Wolf - the maintainers of Task Coach - to check if it was possible to get the feature done with the help of an external developer as we do not have the time to develop the feature by ourselves.
Frank, Jérôme and Aaron agreed on the design and acceptance criteria and here we go!
The goal of this campaign is to fund the development of the ability to rearrange columns with drag and drop in Task Coach.
• You will get this feature for free with an upcoming version of Task Coach We expect the completion with version 1.3.2x. (current version is 1.3.18)
• The code will be fully open sourced to ensure the freedoms of Open Source software are preserved.
We're giving Task Coach users a feature they want and we're giving the generic (i.e. the part that is not Task Coach specific) functionality back to the wxPython community.
How we are planning to spend the money
• We have already designed the feature and estimated the development effort. Frank and Jérôme have reviewed the architecture designed by Yurii.
This is how we are planning to spend the money
<li>The total costs for development are about USD 2.000
paying Yurii, an external developer capable of WxWidgets code. Yurii is a Task Coach user himself.

• The rest of the money will be used as a buffer if more development / testing is needed than anticipated. If not needed then the money will be spent on our infrastructure (issue tracking, wiki, mockup tools).
Any overfunding will go directly to Frank Niessink, Jérôme Laheurte and Aaron Wolf, the maintainers of Task Coach. They will then decide what to do with the overfunding.
What if we can't reach our goal?

This has been set up as a ""Fixed Funding"" project. If the project fails to hit its funding goal, your money will be refunded.
However we will not be able to complete the feature.

Please support this feature now.
This is a great opportunity for you to support a tool you are using for free on a daily basis. By doing so you become part of the bigger story.

AirClip is first in line when it comes to smart accessories designed and produced for the purpose of complementing the use of Apple’s new wireless earphones AirPods. AirClip boasts a design that integrates item loss countermeasures in both its physical and technological aspect. It not only protects the AirPods from being dropped or lost, but also provides protection for the charging case.
When Apple first made the announcement of the upcoming wireless earphones in late 2016, it came as a pleasant surprise for all the avid apple product users, including our product team.

However, when we saw the actual AirPods on display during the showcase by Apple’s CEO Tim Cook, we couldn’t help but question ourselves.Could these Airpods really adapt to any and all situations? Also, given that the charging case is no bigger than a cupcake, wouldn’t these chargers easily drop or go missing?

With these questions in mind, we turned to Reddit in the hopes of obtaining some user experience on the matter. Luckily, we stumbled across a comic drew on the subject, and that very comic inspired the creation of AirClip

AirClip was designed using the latest technology in order to ensure maximized performance, all while maintaining a stylish appearance. For its users, the AirClip aims to provide free and easy access to the convenience and luxurious lifestyle that is made possible by smart devices.
Airclip is a stylish accessory for your AirPods.
AirClip gives your AirPods a personal style, making it your own unique fashion trademark.Using Airclip with your AirPods will always be your best option.
No matter you are someone likes to keep it clean  and simple
Or someone loves freedom and acts on the spur of the moment .
With the support of AirClip, AirPods can be more comfortably/suitably used under a wider number of situations, such as during exercise or work.

Through the use of our software application made specifically for Airclip, you can set up a two-way loss prevention mechanism to ensure that you won’t have to worry about losing either your phone or your AirPods. However, please be aware that the Bluetooth wireless functionality must be kept on during use, and that you pay close attention to the notifications from both the application and your AirClip
No matter you lose your Airpods or your Iphone. AirClip will always help you find them.
Our team is composed of graduates from different countries. We believe in the principle of  ""Innovation originates from technology, change starts from our mind"". We are passionate about what we do.

Although we have overcome most of the technical difficulties we came across during the manufacturing process, it remains a possibility that there may be future difficulties that are unforeseen and may delay our progress. If that does become the case, we will be sure to notify our investors/supporters on Indiegogo of the situation immediately.
Due to the nature of the organization of crowd funded projects, we unfortunately cannot make refunds once an order is placed.

Our ultimate goal is to let our users enjoy a lifestyle characterized by more freedom. At this time, we have approached the end of the product manufacturing process. Now all we need is the invaluable support from all of you to finalize this process so that we can deliver your very own AirClip to you.

>

We are very happy for all the support we received during the crowdfunding campaign. Thank you! That is why at Citysens we keep working to make the new modular garden a reality. Visit our webpage and leave us your email to continue in the loop! 

www.citysens.com


Clica aquí para ir a la versión en castellano

- Envíos a toda España gratuitos - 


#GreenUp! Let's turn our homes, offices and cities into greener spaces! Discover how you can make it happen today.

column1: Citysens helps you enjoy more plants with less hassle. Due to its modular design, you can personalise it to suit your own space. Its automatic irrigation system ensures your plants will survive the most careless of us. Now you can easily make your home, office or working space a greener place with the new Citysens garden.

Enjoy more plants, worry less. Enjoy up to 8 plants in the space of 1. Citysens incorporates an automatic irrigation system that takes care of your plants on daily basis alowing them to grow healthy and look great. The system lasts for 1 to 2 months without needing to refill the base.
Citysens is the perfect gift. Citysens can be assembled in just 5 minutes by any person. You can also personalise the height and the direction of the pods to fit your own style.

column2: once you have a Citysens garden you'll only need to fill the water reservoir with water and nutrients once every 40-60 days. The necessary power consumption to pump the water and nutrients upwards is less than 3€/year. We'll provide nutrients for your garden with an estimated price of 30€/year (37$/year).
>      - we'll send you the full vertical garden in a box! -

column1: allows you to transform any spot. It's designed to surprise your visitors and
for you to experience the scent of a garden all year round.
<div>Personalize your garden according to your taste. You can choose colour and plant family. <span style=""font-size: 16px
column3: >There are two available colours: ivory and dark brown.

column2: >We will contact you by the end of the campaign for the structure colour and plant family choice.

column9:
>

Choose from our variety of plant families, the one that best suits you and the light conditions of your space: each plant family creates a unique atmosphere!

column5: >

column1: We will contact you by the end of the campaign for the structure colour and plant family choice.

Every year, 10 billion plants are thrown away all over the world because of a lack of proper care. In fact, many of us don't have plants because we feel frustated by them. Others don't have the time or the space to enjoy them.
At Citysens we want to solve these issues with a unique garden:
- It’s made of bioplastic, from renewable biomass.
- You save up to 50% in water and mineral salts compared to traditional systems.
- Power consumption of less than 3€/year (thanks to its low-consumption water pump which is automatically turned on for 15 min per day)
- Transforms not only our spaces but also our cities: enjoy a greener environment and cleaner air.

Did you know that plants feed on various mineral salts that they absorb from soil? In soil, bacteria and worms transform organic matter into these mineral salts. Citysens works without soil. In this way, we avoid dirt and achieve a lighter vertical structure. Using the technology of hydroponics, we are able to deliver the optimal mixture of mineral salts that each family of plant needs using our automatic irrigation system.
Instead of soil we use rockwool and peach pits. Our peach pits are recycled from the juice industry and they helps roots find the water, nutrients and oxygen they need.
- Water and nutrients can be reused

Citysens began more than 2 years ago when Xavi first constructed a hydroponic vertical garden with tomatoes. At this time he was finishing his doctoral thesis in nanosensors at the Universitat Rovira i Virgili in Tarragona (Spain).

After finishing the doctoral thesis, Xavi teamed up with Francisco Andrade and Par Blanking (members at the Innovation Hub of the Universitat Rovira i Virgili) and together started exploring the opportunities behind the relationship between people and nature in the city. We discovered that the main barriers preventing people from enjoying nature in cities are time, space and expertise...so we started Citysens in order to solve that!

column3:
>

After talking to more than 250 people and experimenting with 5 prototypes, we developed the first Citysens garden. The first viable Citysens design had an excelent feedback from our first 70 clients. Nowadays, these first clients are our friends, and together we have improved the design to what you can see today.

>

The Citysens team has grown to continue to strive for excellence in our design: today the team is formed of Maria Rius (Nua Arquitectures), Blanca Serres, David Gironès, Par Blanking (Borders Crossing), Francisco Andrade (Innovation Hub) and Xavi Rius. We partnered up with Lucid Product Agency and Pixel Moreno to bring market the best Citysens experience.

column1: Our name CITYSENS arises from the essence of our values: we want to improve citizens quality of life through the development of innovative solutions, making our cities a better place to live in. That is why we care about our environmental impact, work with special employment centers and produce our products in Europe.

Citysens is a new experience that allows the average person to be in close contact with nature in their own space. Now we need your support: collaborate with this crowdfunding campaign to make Citysens viable and transform our cities into greener spaces.

Your contributions are vital for the future of the project. Without them, we won't be able to afford the costly initial investment to make the new Citysens garden a reality. The money of your contributions will be used in:
• Design refinement (10% of the total amount) - we're listening to your opinion!

For hardware products, the more we make, the cheaper the cost of the production setup and to the molds. Moreover, our suppliers apply minimum order quantities. The goal of this campaign is to secure 400 orders as the minimum amount of orders to start the production of Citysens.
We'll use the funds of this campaign to produce the best Citysens garden ever! This is our timeline:
November - Mid December: making lots of new Indiegogo friends
Mid December - January: design refinement and finalizing prototypes
February: manufacturing agreements and place the tooling orders
March: quality assurance, product homologation and product validation
May: begin manufacturing for the  bioplastic-based injection molded parts
June: finalise the assembly and shipment process
We are very proud that our team and partners have a vast experience in the design and development of new products and the development of new business models.

column3: >We want to secure the maximum quality of such an awesome product. Although we have experience in the product design and manufacturing, these are some of the risks we are exposed to:

column1: Manufacturing: creating the tooling to manufacture a product of this size is expensive and requires expert knowledge to get it right. Creating the best molds for a product of this size is vital and this is where delays could occur. To minimize that possibility we're working with tooling manufacturers partners with a track record for prompt quality.

Product adjustments: as Citysens gets geared up for production, there will likely be some minor adjustments to improve the final product. Pre-production prototypes will be made to test and refine the product. These will always be for the benefit of you, the best clients ever. We will let you know exactly how the process is advancing.

Fulfilment: sometimes things go ugly and can’t be planned for: a supplier misses a deadline, a machine breaks down, or a shipment gets lost. Those things could happen. To minimize the possibility of manufacturing setbacks we will locate and contact at least one back-up supplier for each part of the process.
- What happens when plants grow too big?

The plants we have chosen for the Citysens garden are medium size plants that do not grow very large. Remember, that because we use hydroponics, the plant’s roots will always have water and nutrients readily available and so do not grow as big as in soil (where they need to search for water and nutrients). If you ever want to change a plant, you can do it easily: take the plant out and carefully transplant it to a pot with soil. Be aware, you'll have to water it daily then!
- Does the Citysens garden need to be plugged?
Yes. Citysens garden includes a small pump coupled to
a timer that needs to be plugged to a power source. Our aim is that you can
avoid the constant watering of plants. Be aware the power consumption of the
pump is very low, less than 3 €/year! If this small power consumption allows
you to have more beautiful plants at home, we believe that spending on
electricity is well justified! Besides, there are now companies that offer
electricity from renewable sources, did you know?
- Do you use a pump? Is it noisy?
Yes, we use a pump to automatically water and feed plants every day. We selected our pump from 8 different options and made sure to select the quietest one, which makes practically no noise.
- Can I choose the plants for my Citysens garden?

Yes, once the campaign is over we will send a form to all our backers so they can choose their desired plant family. Backers will choose among four plant families: life red, pure green, placid blue and green aromas. Choice will be made according to personal tastes and taking into acount the light requirements of the plant family. We are working to offer new plant families soon.
- What colours are available for the Citysens garden?

Once the campaign is over we will send a form to all our backers so they can choose their desired colour for the structure. The Citysens garden is available in ivory white and dark brown to best suit the décor of your space.
- What are Citysens nutrients made of?

The nutrients we use are simply various mineral salts, which are mixed up to provide the optimum food needed by each plant family. We use common salts such as calcium nitrate or potassium phosphate. The salt mixture does not contain synthetic compounds such as hormones. Different plant families have different needs, for example, did you know that plants which flower require a very different food from aromatic herbs? We'll provide you with the exact mixture of salts for your garden!
- What is the current Citysens garden made of?

We are working on finding the most suitable material to create a quality product that respects the environment. We are evaluating the use of bioplastics made from renewable biomass. In the Citysens garden, plants grow on rockwool and peach pits. The peach pit is a waste of the juice industry, which we reuse to become an ideal medium for the roots to find the water and food that the plant needs.
Yes, all our products come with a 2 year warranty and we will pass CE and FCC certifications.

column1: Verde Puro (interior, poca luz, plantas purificadoras del aire)
Colabora con el proyecto: clica aquí para ir a las recompensas

Cada año, 10.000 millones de plantas se tiran a la basura porque son muy bonitas cuando las compramos pero después no podemos cuidar de ellas. De hecho, mucha gente no tiene plantas porque se ha frustrado después de que se le mueran todas. Otros no tienen tiempo o espacio para disfrutar de ellas.
Queremos solucionar estos problemas con una herramienta única: el jardín Citysens.
- Ahorra hasta un 50% en agua y nutrientes respecto al sistema tradicional
- Con un consumo eléctrico de menos de 3 euros/año (gracias a que la bomba de bajo consumo se conecta automáticamente solo 25 min al día)
- Transforma no solo el espacio pero también las ciudades, convirtiendo cada rincón, cada casa, cada oficina, en espacios más verdes y con aire más puro.
¿Sabías que las plantas se nutren de sales minerales que absorben de la tierra?

En la tierra, bacterias y lombrices transforman la materia orgánica en sales minerales que es el alimento de las plantas. Citysens funciona sin tierra. Así evitas suciedad y ganas comodidad.Utilizando la tecnología llamada hidroponía somos capaces de aportar las sales minerales que cada planta necesita mediante el agua de riego.

En vez de tierra, utilizamos lana de roca y huesos de melocotón. Los huesos de melocotón son un residuo de la industria del zumo que en nuestro jardines Citysens ayudan a las raíces a encontrar el agua, los nutrientes y el oxígeno que necesitan. La hidroponía tiene varias ventajas:
- Las plantas necesitan menos espacio para crecer igual
- El agua y los nutrientes pueden ser reutilizados

Citysens nació hace más de 2 años, cuando Xavi Rius montó su primer jardín vertical hidropónico de tomates en su oficina. En este tiempo, Xavi estaba terminando su tesis doctoral en nanosensores en la Universitat Rovira i Virgili de Tarragona (España).

Después de terminar la tesis doctoral, Xavi se asoció con Francisco Andrade y Par (miembros del Innovation Hub de la Universitat Rovira i Virgili) para explorar las oportunidades detrás de la relación de personas y naturaleza en las ciudades. Descubrimos que las principales barreras para disfrutar de la naturaleza en las ciudades son el tiempo, el espacio y la experiencia ... así que empezamos Citysens para solucionar eso!

column6: >Después de hablar con más de 250 personas y de iterar con 5 primeros prototipos, desarrollamos el primer jardín Citysens: un primer diseño viable de Citysens que ha tenido una excelente acogida por parte de los primeros 70 clientes. Hoy en día, estos primeros clientes son nuestros amigos ya que juntos hemos mejorado el diseño del nuevo jardín Citysens.

>El equipo de Citysens ha crecido para llevar al mercado la mejor experiencia Citysens: hoy el equipo está formado por Maria Rius (Nua Arquitecturas), Blanca Serres, David Gironès, Par Blanking (Borders Crossing), Francisco Andrade (Innovation Hub) y Xavi Rius. Hemos formado equipo también con la agencia de diseño de producto Lúcid y el estudio de fotografía Pixel Moreno.

column1: Nuestro nombre CITYSENS surgió de la esencia de nuestros valores: queremos mejorar la calidad de vida de los ciudadanos de todo el mundo a través del desarrollo de soluciones innovadoras. Trabajamos para minimizar nuestro impacto medioambiental, colaboramos con centros especiales de trabajo y con escuelas, y producimos nuestros productos en España.
Citysens es una nueva experiencia que nos permite estar en contacto con la naturaleza en la ciudad.
Necesitamos su apoyo a esta campaña de micromecenazgo para hacer Citysens viable y transformar nuestras ciudades en espacios más verdes.
Colabora con el proyecto: clica aquí para ir a las recompensas

Tu dinero es vital para hacer realidad el nuevo jardín vertical y modular Citysens. Sin tu contribución no podremos hacer frente a la gran inversión inicial necesaria para fabricar el nuevo jardín Citysens. Tus aportaciones a la campaña serán utilizadas para:
• Los moldes de inyección para fabricar el jardín (60%)

column6: >Para productos de este tipo, como más hagamos, más barato será el costo unitario. Por otra parte, nuestros proveedores aplican cantidades mínimas de fabricación Para que esta campaña sea un éxito, necesitamos conseguir como mínimo 400 pedidos para hacer frente a la producción de Citysens con los precios propuestos.

column1: Noviembre - Diciembre: hacer muchos nuevos amigos en Indiegogo
Enero: refinar el diseño y finalizar las iteraciones de prototipo
Febrero: cerrar los acuerdos de fabricación, de las partes del jardín y de otras herramientas de fabricación
Marzo: cumplir los certificados de calidad, las homologaciones de producto y validar el producto final
Mayo: empezar la producción de las piezas hechas en biopolímero
Junio: finalizar el montaje y embalaje, envío de las recompensas
Estamos muy orgullosos de nuestro equipo y de los colaboradores. Tenemos una gran experiencia en el diseño y desarrollo de nuevos productos y nuevos modelos de negocio.

column11: >Nuestro objetivo de la campaña es llegar a tus manos en las mejores condiciones y asegurar la máxima calidad del producto. Aunque tenemos experiencia en el diseño y fabricación de productos, estos son algunos riesgos a los que estamos expuestos:

column1: FABRICACIÓN: la creación de las herramientas para la fabricación de un producto de este tamaño es caro y requiere de una expertez para evitar errores. La creación de los mejores moldes para un producto de este tamaño es de vital importancia y es aquí donde podrían producirse retrasos. Para minimizar esta posibilidad, estamos trabajando con fabricantes de utillajes con trayectoria de calidad.

AJUSTES DE PRODUCTO: en el proceso de producción del jardín Citysens, es probable que haya algunos ajustes menores con tal de mejorar el producto final. Se realizarán prototipos de preproducción para probar y refinar el producto. Todos los cambios siempre serán para beneficio de los mecenas y os informaremos puntualmente de los avances del proyecto.

CUMPLIMIENTO: a veces las cosas se ponen feas sin que se puedan planificar: un proveedor pierde una fecha límite, una máquina se rompe, o un envío se pierde. Estas cosas suceden. Para reducir al mínimo esta posibilidad, vamos a localizar y contactar con al menos un proveedor de respaldo para cada parte del proceso.

Las plantas que elegimos para el jardín Citysens son plantas de tamaño medio que no crecen muy grandes. Si alguna vez deseas cambiar una planta, puedes hacerlo fácilmente: puedes translantar cuidadosamente la planta a una maceta con tierra. Sin embargo, ten en cuenta que tendrás que regarla todos los días!
- ¿El jardín Citysens necesita ser enchufado a la corriente?

Sí, el jardín incluye una pequeña bomba conectada a un temporizador que necesita ser enchufada a la corriente. Con ello, te ahorras el riego que se te mueran las plantas constantemente. Ten en cuenta que el consumo de energía de la bomba es muy bajo, de menos de 2 €/año! Si este pequeño consumo de energía le permite disfrutar de plantas más bonitas, ¡creemos que el gasto en electricidad está bien justificado! Además, ahora hay empresas que ofrecen la electricidad de fuentes renovables, contacta con una de ellas, nosotros ya lo hemos hecho.
- ¿Puedo elegir las plantas para mi jardín Citysens?

Sí, una vez que la campaña haya terminado enviaremos un formulario a todos nuestros mecenas para que puedan elegir su familia de la plantas. Se podrá elegir entre cuatro familias de plantas: Rojo Vital, Verde Puro, Azul Plácido y Aromas Verdes. La elección se hará de acuerdo a tus gustos personales y teniendo en cuenta las necesidades de luz de cada familia de plantas. Estamos trabajando para ofrecer nuevas familias de plantas pronto.
- ¿Qué colores están disponibles para el jardín Citysens?

Igual que con las plantas, una vez que la campaña haya terminado le enviaremos un formulario a todos nuestros mecenas para que puedan elegir el color de estructura deseado. El jardín Citysens estárá disponible en blanco mate y en un marrón oscuro, siempre colores muy elegantes!
- ¿De qué están hechos los nutrientes Citysens?

Los nutrientes que utilizamos son simplemente sales minerales, que se mezclan para proporcionar el alimento óptimo que cada familia de plantas necesita. Utilizamos sales comunes, tales como nitrato de calcio o fosfato de potasio. La mezcla de sales no contiene compuestos sintéticos tales como hormonas. ¿Sabías que las plantas con flor requieren un alimento muy diferente a las hierbas aromáticas, por ejemplo? Nosotros le proporcionaremos a las plantas la mezcla exacta de alimento para cada momento.
- ¿De qué está hecho el jardín Citysens?

El jardín estará hecho con biopolímero, un material respetuoso con el medio ambiente. En el jardín Citysens, las plantas crecen en lana de roca y huesos de melocotón. El hueso de melocotón es un residuo de la industria del zumo, que nosotros reutilizamos para convertirlo en un medio ideal para que las raíces encuentren el agua y el alimento que necesitan.
- Tengo una tienda en la que quiero vender jardines Citysens ¿a quién debo contactar?
¡Genial! La campaña de micromecenazgo es un gran momento para adquirir tus jardines a un precio excelente, escríbenos a a hola@citysens.com o llámanos al +34 606197713

","We are very happy for all the support we received during the crowdfunding campaign. Thank you! That is why at Citysens we keep working to make the new modular garden a reality. Visit our webpage and leave us your email to continue in the loop! www.citysens.comClica aquí para ir a la versión en castellano- Envíos a toda España gratuitos - #GreenUp! Let's turn our homes, offices and cities into greener spaces! Discover how you can make it happen today.

Citysens helps you enjoy more plants with less hassle. Due to its modular design, you can personalise it to suit your own space. Its automatic irrigation system ensures your plants will survive the most careless of us. Now you can easily make your home, office or working space a greener place with the new Citysens garden.

Enjoy more plants, worry less. Enjoy up to 8 plants in the space of 1. Citysens incorporates an automatic irrigation system that takes care of your plants on daily basis alowing them to grow healthy and look great. The system lasts for 1 to 2 months without needing to refill the base.
Citysens is the perfect gift. Citysens can be assembled in just 5 minutes by any person. You can also personalise the height and the direction of the pods to fit your own style.

column2: once you have a Citysens garden you'll only need to fill the water reservoir with water and nutrients once every 40-60 days. The necessary power consumption to pump the water and nutrients upwards is less than 3€/year. We'll provide nutrients for your garden with an estimated price of 30€/year (37$/year).

column1: - Shipment to Spain is for free -
- we'll send you the full vertical garden in a box! -
allows you to transform any spot. It's designed to surprise your visitors and
for you to experience the scent of a garden all year round.
Personalize your garden according to your taste. You can choose colour and plant family. There are two available colours: ivory and dark brown.
We will contact you by the end of the campaign for the structure colour and plant family choice.
Choose from our variety of plant families, the one that best suits you and the light conditions of your space: each plant family creates a unique atmosphere! Placid Blue (indoors, mid light)
We will contact you by the end of the campaign for the structure colour and plant family choice.

Every year, 10 billion plants are thrown away all over the world because of a lack of proper care. In fact, many of us don't have plants because we feel frustated by them. Others don't have the time or the space to enjoy them.
At Citysens we want to solve these issues with a unique garden:
- It’s made of bioplastic, from renewable biomass.
- You save up to 50% in water and mineral salts compared to traditional systems.
- Power consumption of less than 3€/year (thanks to its low-consumption water pump which is automatically turned on for 15 min per day)
- Transforms not only our spaces but also our cities: enjoy a greener environment and cleaner air.

Did you know that plants feed on various mineral salts that they absorb from soil? In soil, bacteria and worms transform organic matter into these mineral salts. Citysens works without soil. In this way, we avoid dirt and achieve a lighter vertical structure. Using the technology of hydroponics, we are able to deliver the optimal mixture of mineral salts that each family of plant needs using our automatic irrigation system.
Instead of soil we use rockwool and peach pits. Our peach pits are recycled from the juice industry and they helps roots find the water, nutrients and oxygen they need.
- Water and nutrients can be reused

Citysens began more than 2 years ago when Xavi first constructed a hydroponic vertical garden with tomatoes. At this time he was finishing his doctoral thesis in nanosensors at the Universitat Rovira i Virgili in Tarragona (Spain).

After finishing the doctoral thesis, Xavi teamed up with Francisco Andrade and Par Blanking (members at the Innovation Hub of the Universitat Rovira i Virgili) and together started exploring the opportunities behind the relationship between people and nature in the city. We discovered that the main barriers preventing people from enjoying nature in cities are time, space and expertise...so we started Citysens in order to solve that!

After talking to more than 250 people and experimenting with 5 prototypes, we developed the first Citysens garden. The first viable Citysens design had an excelent feedback from our first 70 clients. Nowadays, these first clients are our friends, and together we have improved the design to what you can see today.

The Citysens team has grown to continue to strive for excellence in our design: today the team is formed of Maria Rius (Nua Arquitectures), Blanca Serres, David Gironès, Par Blanking (Borders Crossing), Francisco Andrade (Innovation Hub) and Xavi Rius. We partnered up with Lucid Product Agency and Pixel Moreno to bring market the best Citysens experience.

Our name CITYSENS arises from the essence of our values: we want to improve citizens quality of life through the development of innovative solutions, making our cities a better place to live in. That is why we care about our environmental impact, work with special employment centers and produce our products in Europe.

Citysens is a new experience that allows the average person to be in close contact with nature in their own space. Now we need your support: collaborate with this crowdfunding campaign to make Citysens viable and transform our cities into greener spaces.

Your contributions are vital for the future of the project. Without them, we won't be able to afford the costly initial investment to make the new Citysens garden a reality. The money of your contributions will be used in:
Design refinement (10% of the total amount) - we're listening to your opinion!

For hardware products, the more we make, the cheaper the cost of the production setup and to the molds. Moreover, our suppliers apply minimum order quantities. The goal of this campaign is to secure 400 orders as the minimum amount of orders to start the production of Citysens.
We'll use the funds of this campaign to produce the best Citysens garden ever! This is our timeline:
November - Mid December: making lots of new Indiegogo friends
Mid December - January: design refinement and finalizing prototypes
February: manufacturing agreements and place the tooling orders
March: quality assurance, product homologation and product validation
April: pre-production build and pilot production
May: begin manufacturing for the  bioplastic-based injection molded parts
June: finalise the assembly and shipment process
