column1: ","Lil Nika is a small design-oriented company that is ridiculously ambitious. Our aspiration is to embed creativity in everyday objects that help spark your child's imagination. 'Tested on children' is a motto we adopt to ensure that not only by design but in practice, each object is created to maximise its own play potential.  Emi needs your help to survive and your support will go to adding a friend and perhaps more. Please help our campaign to support her. www.lilnika.comIntroducing Emi the Elephant night light,  an original and a creative first.

Emi functions as a table lamp or a wall light, but what we think is that extra bit special is as a role-playing headwear, where you and your child get a free pass to a world of imagination and a safari adventure. (New! http://inhabitat.com/emi-from-lil-nika-is-a-fun...)(Don't forget to scroll down below to see where we have been featured in!)_________________________________________________________________________Exuding a soft glowing light in the nursery, we want Emi to be your child's BFF (best friend forever) right from the start. An integrated low heat lighting has been designed to give you the flexibility of use and custom made LED casing offers 4 alternate options and is even portable (USB connector)!Emi is grey on the outside and green in the middle! made from 100% recycled plastic from Japan.  We discovered along the way, few choose to re-use, because it's harder! but isn't it always to do the right thing! Simple origami inspired design allows you to easily create much more than a 3d jigsaw! 2 parts head, 3 parts body and 1 part binoculars for learning!Everything included. LED, USB cable, power adapter and even the screws for wall mounting are included! Even though Emi & Imo have been designed to be put together with your child, we are looking to create a pre-assembled option for those mommies and daddies that just want to focus their efforts on role play!_________________________________________________________________________A detailed booklet is included, as is an online step by step easy to follow video instruction of folding, creasing and locking. We all know a child takes so much more pride and pleasure in what they create themselves even if they sometimes get a little helping hand! (yes that means you daddy!).So, are you ready to get jiggy!? Emi and Imo need your support._________________________________________________________________________We need $25,000 to produce Imo the Hippo night light. This amount will go to purchasing, production, steel molds and labour. In return you will get a chance to be one of the first to have your own as an original gift and you get of course our eternal gratitude from helping this small company live and give us the confidence to explore new ideas and new products.Our REDSAFARI night lights are inspired by five loving animals to play chase, hide and seek and pretend to go on a safari tour! Our animals are almost complete, and with your help we can have a family ready by early 2015! Furthermore, we have a modern TREEHOUSE called Open Cloud  that can transform into White Cloud, another multi-functional product that we have designed. It is a self standing structure without a base making it safe and hygienic. It has two functions, a tunnel and a cave!Finally, we have designed smaller series of tactile accessories to make your child and their safari pets an item. You think only Paris Hilton and her 35 pets can be stylish? Our PICK'n'MIX theme will 'naturally' be dazzling!Don't fall asleep now! We are almost there :)Your contribution will not just help us survive, it represents support for the idea of introducing educational and creative underlays into everyday products.  The perks you get in return for helping are real and guaranteed delivered right to your doorstep (worldwide delivery included) at considerable discount. Help us make it a reality, sign up today.Expected delivery date is a late estimation only, we will try our best to get Imo to you earlier and as fast as we can! If you can't contribute, be a who! make some noise, bang those drums and blow your horns, because we are so small and we want to be heard! Spread the word on your social networking - we need your help!Like us on http://facebook.com/funbydesign and pin us on Pinterest: http://www.pinterest.com/lilnikahk/redsafari-an-animal-silhouette-in-the-night/",24.0,2,"1 Campaign

column3:
>

Patara designs comfortable and stylish shoes inspired by the tropics. We sell our handmade shoes in limited runs and carefully select each textile we use. Over half of the fabrics used in our first order are handwoven and sourced from weaving collectives around the world.

We believe in fair trade and supporting communities by promoting their local skills and traditions. By supporting this Kickstarter campaign, you will play a vital role in bringing Patara to life. We want to support the craftsmen who make our shoes and the weavers who make our fabric.

The money raised here will ensure that they are paid a fair wage and allow us to fund our first order and get them to San Diego. We understand that waste comes along with production. This is why we are committed to the use of as many sustainable materials as possible. Our shoes are made with organic cotton fibers, jute outsole bumpers, and insoles which are lined with a natural cork layer ensuring breathability in the warmest of climates.

We believe that many of life’s most valuable experiences are gained through travel. While exploring the globe, we have met some amazing people, discovered surreal landscapes, and most importantly, we have grown from these experiences. Often our most memorable and unexpected moments would happen while in the pursuit of another destination. As our buddy J.R.R Tolkien said:
column4:
>“Not all those who wander are lost”

Patara doesn't directly translate into English, but roughly means auspicious or good fortune in Thai. Something we at Patara wish for everyone while traveling or in their everyday life.  

Thanks for the support and wander on!
column5: >
column14: >
column34: >Navy Mineral Wash Patara T-Shirt
column37: >20oz Mizu V6 Insulated Stainless Steel Bottle
column38: >Keeps drinks cold for 24 hours and hot for 12 hours
column52:
> 

Risks and challenges

Footwear production involves a lot of moving parts before we get a finished product. Naturally there are risks and challenges that must be recognized and overcome.

Our process starts with sourcing raw materials, then crafting them into shoes. Thankfully, all our materials for the first order have arrived in our factory and are ready to be made into shoes. We have already allocated a schedule with the factory and are ready to go. If we should receive far more funding than our goal, delivery may be take longer than expected. We are confident we will be able to meet demand and are dedicated to great customer service, and will always keep you updated.

These are skilled craftsmen at every station who take pride in their work. Materials and components are inspected and tested separately and as a finished product to assure quality control at every stage of production.

Once production is completed, we will then have to import the product to our warehouse here in San Diego. There is always the risk of delays in transit and customs clearance but we are doing everything to ensure a smooth delivery.

At Patara we understand that there are always risks but we believe our skill and our willingness to work hard will allow us to fulfill any order with no problem.

Something we at Patara wish for everyone while traveling or in their everyday life.  Thanks for the support and wander on!Navy Mineral Wash Patara T-ShirtMen's Sizes XS – XXL20oz Mizu V6 Insulated Stainless Steel BottleKeeps drinks cold for 24 hours and hot for 12 hours   Risks and challengesFootwear production involves a lot of moving parts before we get a finished product. Naturally there are risks and challenges that must be recognized and overcome.Our process starts with sourcing raw materials, then crafting them into shoes. Thankfully, all our materials for the first order have arrived in our factory and are ready to be made into shoes. We have already allocated a schedule with the factory and are ready to go. If we should receive far more funding than our goal, delivery may be take longer than expected. We are confident we will be able to meet demand and are dedicated to great customer service, and will always keep you updated.These are skilled craftsmen at every station who take pride in their work. Materials and components are inspected and tested separately and as a finished product to assure quality control at every stage of production.Once production is completed, we will then have to import the product to our warehouse here in San Diego. There is always the risk of delays in transit and customs clearance but we are doing everything to ensure a smooth delivery.At Patara we understand that there are always risks but we believe our skill and our willingness to work hard will allow us to fulfill any order with no problem.",45.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1: If you can contribute with more than money, I would really appreciate your help by telling bloggers, news sites and friends about this project.

column2: >The funding goal of 20 000 € will be used to:

column1: If this project does not reach funding goal within the time range  Indiegogo will give your money back. But then this project will not succeed and sadly no Easy wallets will be delivered.
I would really appreciate all help i could possible get to spread the word about this project. Thank you!
Im currently studying product design in Sweden and will graduate in about two months. I have learned alot about the process to develop products.
Dreaming up new products is what i tend to do at my ""free time"" and would therefore be very happy to get the opportunity to work with this full time with your help.

At my university we have not yet tried to actually launch and deliver a product. It´s here where my interest in manufacturing process and building a company comes in handy. I have spend a long time into this product to make sure its possible to produce in high quality and within price range. I have also made shure that I can offer free worldwide shipping within these costs and as fast as possible put easy wallet in your hand!
By supporting this project you will make me able to develop other innovative products in the future. I have alot more cool ideas to work on after Easy wallet have been delivered to you.

long-time friends who are behind Palm Shades. We met while doing volunteer work
in sunny Florida back in 2003, and developed a love for all things sunny and
warm! We started a business in 2008 and learned a lot of necessary lessons about
how we work together and about business in general. Sam has been in charge of
purchasing for a major corporation for the last few years and Dave has been an
owner in a few start-ups. All these experiences have lead us to walk down the
take our love of adventure and the outdoors and tie the Palm Shades brand into
that lifestyle. We have found the best quality sunglasses made with natural bamboo,
polarized lenses, great UV protection, and made sure it could fit Dave's big
head (and other big heads) using flexible arms. We want to share this product
raise money to purchase materials in bulk as we need to meet minimum order
quantities to get Palm Shades off the ground.  We also would like to purchase
enough inventory to cover the INDIEGOGO orders and have inventory left over for
the continuation of our business through our website and other online outlets.
providing a great looking product at an affordable price.  By purchasing
in bulk we keep our costs down and ensure that we can offer our sunglasses at a
lower price than most, if not all, of our competitors.

Designed in a small shop in NYC with the goal of combining class, convenience and comfort. The Maverick presents itself in a super slim profile that offers quick access to your essential items to keep your life streamlined. Your wallet should hold more than just your cash.

column2: >A suitable wallet for the best dressed man in the room

column1: Subtle and Elegant, the Maverick is a multifaceted wallet that fits in any of your pockets:
column3: >Easily fits in your back pocket
column5: >Perfectly fits in your breast pocket
column7: >Comfortably slides into your front pocket
column9: >For ultimate convenience, place it in your jacket's inside pocket
column11:
>

The Maverick is constructed of luxurious vegetable-tanned leather, ensuring that the wallet will develop a rich patina over time. The front two card slots along with the quick draw can hold up to 8 cards all major currencies while still retaining its sleek profile. We used printed nylon for the quick draw, thus providing strength and smooth retrieval of your cards. The handcrafted top pouch is designed to hold a handkerchief or provide storage for small items. The Maverick is as agile as you, always ready for the draw.

 

 

 

 

The rounded notches are designed to allow you to wrap your earbuds around the Maverick tangle free, while keeping your earbuds recessed from the edge of the wallet. This avoids interference from your earbuds when taking the Maverick out of your pocket.

 

 

Anyone who has ever used a pocket handkerchief knows that it stays in place for about as long as it takes to fold it. So the Maverick was designed to keep your handkerchief in place. Use the top pouch or the elastic band to secure your handkerchief and then adjust your handkerchief to the desired height. Displaying as much or as little of the handkerchief as fits your style.
column15: >Use your wallet's elastic band or the top pouch
column16:
> 

With the Maverick, you won’t have to fumble for your keys or loose change. Simply place them in the top pouch and keep your pockets clear.
column20: s=5c05c93a5c49e613f4666a660c4c04d2"" src="""" style=""""/>
column21: >Slate with Charcoal Houndstooth
column22: >Cognac with Goldenrod Houndstooth
column23:
>Chocolate with Charcoal Houndstooth

The “Wipe Away” is where fashion meets function. Made with proprietary fiber specifically designed to remove smudges from your phone or tablet. Now your handkerchief will double as a screen cleaner.
column28:
>Keep your phone or your glasses free of fingerprints

 

The Joey can be placed in the pouch of the Maverick, thus securing the Wipe Away in place. The structure provided by the Joey makes inserting or removing the Wipe Away effortless, while never having to remove the Maverick from your pocket. There are five height rungs on the Joey  to ensure that no matter the depth of your jacket pocket you can display as much or as little of the wipe away as desired.
column33: >The Joey and the Wipe Away can be used with or without the Maverick
column38: >The Joey and Wipe Away together with the Maverick
column39: >The beginning stages of the Maverick
column40:
>Our finalized product

The late musician Louis Armstrong once remarked ""What we play is life"". Here at Sebastien Grey we play with love, hard work and innovation to create perfectly fitted garments. We would like to parlay our passion for craftsmanship into a line of everyday accessories, so we are starting with this wallet. We are perfectionists, and we were moved to execute the most elegant and intelligent wallet that we would want to own. And without doubt we now have it in our pocket!
column41:
>From Left to Right: Stephanie, Mr. Leo, Donnie, Yany

We humbly thank you for visiting our project and hope you enjoyed our campaign!
column46:
>Thank for visiting our campaign​​

column2:
>

 

Do you remember that sense of accomplishment you got the first time you crafted something with your own hands?

Today we invite you to create your own unique, personalised wallet with us in just a few short hours. You can take pride not only in the process of making it, but also in the final product which will serve you well for many years to come.

We want to involve as many people as possible in the handmade movement- it is truly interesting and rewarding.
column3:
>


Each kit contains everything you need to make your wallet:

column1: • Ready to assemble, high quality leather parts of the wallet, which have been expertly laser cut to exact specifications.
• Customisable thread for stitching the wallet together (choose from one of 8 colours and make your mark!)
• 100% natural, beeswax based balm for conditioning the leather and polishing the edges of your wallet.
• A wooden tool specially designed for polishing the edges of your wallet.

column2:
>

 

This Bifold wallet is designed for men who want to have all the necessary documents at hand.
We have prepared a place for a registration certificate, driving license, bank cards and cash. It will accommodate up to six cards.  
 


Choose one of the following four colours for the wallet:
column3:
>

 

A minimalist card and cash wallet all-in-one! This functional design is perfect for those looking to carry their cards and cash, while keeping everything organized and compact. The wallet holds up to 6 cards. With the front pocket will be able to easily pay by using PayPass as there is no need to get the card out of the wallet.


Choose one of the following four colours for the wallet:
column4:
>

 

This card holder is ideal for a night out. You can bring any amount of cash. The main compartment holds up to five cards.


Choose one of the following four colours for the wallet:
column7: >Choose from one of eight colours for the stitching.
column9: >Brown, Beige, Blue, Red, Black, Green, Yellow, Tan
column12:
> 

We have some personalization options for you to make the wallet truly yours. You can put your name or initial or logo. Get the ‘Personalisation’ perk and we will contact you after the campaign is completed to confirm your requirements

Maximum engrave area are 3.5 cm x 3.5 cm.
column14:
>


We only use vegetable tanned Italian leather skins. Vegetable tanning (unlike the most common type of mass market chromium tanning) doesn't use harmful chemicals and is an old world, artisanal process that is practiced by master tanners with decades of experience. It creates highly durable, strong and completely unique skins that age gracefully and are kinder to the environment.

A wallet made from our leather skins will come to life in your hands- each is completely unique, and just like a seasoned explorer it will pick up a character and personality crafted by the adventures you've undertaken, and treasures you have found. With time, you will give your wallet a truly unique and sought after weathered look, one that many try to imitate but will only be found in your hands.
column16:
> 

How long does it take to put a wallet together?

It depends on the model you pick. The Bifold takes less than two hours to put together, for example.

Will I get instructions on how assemble the wallet?

Yes, we will include a detailed video guide on its assembly.

Do I need any additional tools?

No, everything you need will be provided.

How do I select the colour of the stitching and text for personalisation?

After the campaign is completed, we will contact you to confirm your requirements.

Will the leather be the exact same colour I see in the photos?

The colour may vary slightly due to different monitor settings.

When will I get my wallet?

We will start to ship orders in mid January.

Do you cover import fees?

We do not cover import fees/customs fees.

column2:
>

This project is about sharing my first watch design with you. My drive is to create beautiful quality watches with a twist. Watches that are unlike the usual suspects. That is what I want to offer you, a watch that will attract attention and admiration just by itself because of its attractive looks. A watch that will make you feel standing out from the crowd as well by showing off your good taste.

And here it is: The Porthole by Pheidippides Watches.

column1:
Now it is time for you to take me up on my presumption that I made that beautiful quality watch with a twist. I have given my best to create nice design details for you to see and feel, details you will not find often. The result is a bold watch for those who want to make a difference.


You can find The Porthole on


Design

So I wanted to create a watch looking a bit different, right?

Well, somehow inspiration got the better hand of me and I envisioned a watch with a nautical theme. I wanted to use a less likely material for the case and wound up using bronze. It is a softer metal which suffers more from daily use than hardened steel, but it has a lively color and develops a beautiful patina over the years. In due time no watch will look the same.

The case is spherical in more than one way. It has a round footprint and a semi-circular side that flows seamlessly into the curve of the glass giving it a smooth haptic feel. The watch slides easily under the cuff of your shirt.

The case is linked to the strap by movable lugs. The lugs are made of polished stainless steel giving a nice contrast to the bronze case and matching the polished steel hands.

To allow a glance at the watch’s interior, I wanted a see-through back. There was no reason not to include a sapphire window to show the Swiss made movement with a custom rotor. It has 26 jewels and a power reserve of 44 hours. The rotor is finished with beautiful waves.

To make the watch face resemble the sea, the dial is glossy blue lacquered. The hour markers resemble buoys floating on the sea surface, with dots of Superluminova lighting in the dark.

The wide polished steel hands make a bold stand. They have Superluminova on the back making the hands visible at night in their own shadow. The seconds hand looks like a droplet of water. Its only task is to show your watch is still running. Time is essential but should not rule us to the second, right?

The hands and hour markers have matching dimensions, so when the minute hand moves over a marker it will cover it precisely and the Superluminova will glow through the matching hole.

To finish the watch’s design I created a crown that echoes the shape of the case. The custom made crown even has a rim echoing the case-glass transition.

The watch and buckle are held together by a brown genuine leather strap. As an alternative I also selected a black silicone strap which will take to a swim much more gracefully.

And now for the other fun part, creating prototypes.

Being unemployed at the time with a nice inheritance, I have been able to invest time and money in developing prototypes. I am working together with a German workshop to do the technical development and production of the custom made cases. I prefer Swiss suppliers for the watch’s intestines.

July last year I got that brainwave and since then I took my time to refine the drawings again and again until every detail was to my liking. In December the (technical) drawings were finished and the German guys could start their magic at the CNC machine working the case.

Since September I have been busy selecting Swiss suppliers for the parts and by February this year all parts materialized just the way I designed them. Tolerances are nice but some of the design features require accuracy to the one hundredth of a millimeter. We recently finished fine-tuning the case to the actual prototype parts I received to meet those requirements.

The result is a watch just as I'd envisioned, a beautifully executed quality watch for you to enjoy. It took some time and perseverance, but I have been able to bring it all together. Holding that first prototype is a great feeling. A feeling I could convey to you when you decide to pledge for The Porthole.

Main features:
• Polished bronze case and screw-in see-through back, 42mm in diameter and 12.3mm thick
• Polished stainless steel movable lugs, stretched out lug-to-lug size is 55mm, 22mm wide
• Polished nickel hands and hour markers filled with C5 Superluminova
• Movement: STP5-15 by Swiss Technology Production, 44 hours reserve, 26 jewels
• French brown genuine leather or black silicone strap, tapered, size 22/20mm

As I said in the introduction, the bronze will develop a patina over time. This process will take months if not years. If you can't wait that long, you can accelerate it by putting the watch case inside a sealbag together with a crushed boiled egg. Then it happens over night. Here you can see the result of the eggsperiment. You can undo by emerging the watch into cola :-).

Now it is time for the next step: releasing the watch into the world of aficionados such as yourself. The goal of this Indiegogo campaign is to raise enough funds to produce at least a series of 300 watches. And hopefully more... The campaign's target is set for a minimum of 50 watches.

Glasses, hands, dials and movements are supplied from Switzerland. I found a good quality-to-price ratio for each part. Because of its special shape, the case is custom build in a German workshop with experience in making jewelry. Case and back are polished as a pair for the smoothest possible transition. Nevertheless they make the case for a fair price.

A watchmaker colleague and myself will assemble the watches in this German workshop. That allows for an important benefit: I will be on top of the assembly process all the time, so there is continuous in-line Quality Assurance and speedy response to aberrations. In my humble opinion better than doing postproduction Quality Control on finished watches with the risk of having to rework faulty ones from scratch.

In the end I think I made it happen: a beautiful European built quality watch with a fair price tag. By backing my project you will help me to fulfill my dream of creating and sharing my watch. For that gesture I will be very grateful.

The limited series of The Porthole comes in one execution. The colors and materials are pretty well balanced and match the nautical theme wonderfully. Just as I envisioned it. Or... check the stretch goals.

The limited edition watches will be numbered ""Ixxx of I300"" to show their Indiegogo origin. If we don't reach 300, then the actual number of pledges will determine the limited series length. After that the watches will be numbered sequentially.

You will have a choice of 2 straps: brown leather or black silicone. You can let me know your selection during a survey after the project has been successfully funded.

The shadowing effect of the luminova on the back of the hands is less strong on a glossy dial. Although the glossy finish resembles the sea surface as intended, a pearl finish will scatter the light better. You can choose your glossy or pearl finish for the dial in the post-campaign survey.

Stretch target #1:
I designed a custom made pin-buckle for the strap. The buckle echoes the shape of the lugs to form a perfect match with the watch. The standard pin-buckle is swapped with this buckle when we reach € 60,000.

Stretch target #2:
I will include a folding buckle with every watch when we reach € 120,000.

Stretch target #3:
I will include both straps with every watch when we reach € 180,000.

Stretch target #4:
reaching € 240,000 will open up a range of alternative materials and colors. I will offer the case in polished steel, the lugs in bronze and a green dial in both finishes. I might even offer a full brass version (case, lugs, dial, hands, markers). You will be offered a choice of metals and dial color in the post-campaign survey. Any combination is possible.

Your watch has a warranty of 1 year starting on the first day of the month following the month of shipment. After that you can have your watch serviced at your local watchmaker. Spare parts will be available of course.
column2:
>Your pledge goes a long way on Indiegogo. Like any entrepreneur I would like to see my watches on the shelves of shops one day. By then the price will have tripled easily. Distribution channels and shops will take their share in revenue. So this is your chance to be among the first owners of a great watch for an affordable offer.

N.B. for EU residents only: I have to pay your VAT for you. Your VAT is included in the shipping cost as a single amount when you pledge. So don't be startled when you see the shipping cost: it is € 12 shipping + 21% VAT.

column1:
Right after the campaign I will order all parts. It will take anywhere between 3 and 5 month for these orders to fulfill. Most parts will take not much longer than 3 months, but the movements will take up to 4. And we need to account for summer closure of factories. As soon as parts arrive, we will check their quality, so we can act as soon as possible when necessary.

We will start by mounting the glasses, which can be done before the movements arrive, gaining some time. We will also start shipping out the first watches made as soon as possible. We don’t have to wait to send you your perks until all watches are assembled.

We will explore the possibility of having the parts shipped to us in a series of smaller batches. This will enable us to start assembling the watches earlier. There is room for a bit of slack, but we should all be realistic about unforeseen delays. We will do our best to ship your perk on time for the Gift season.


Press kit

You can find a press kit here.
The greatest risk is for me to die during production
column2:
-). I will see to proper contingency, so the project will generate and ship your perks with or without me.

To build the prototype we had to make all of the parts, of course. Some turned out to be straightforward, some challenged even my well known and experienced suppliers, because it turned out some of my wishes were a first to them. In the end the devil has been driven out of every detail, so their is no longer any risk to encounter unforeseen construction challenges or unexpected production technique side effects.

The limited series will be made first and the production schedule is based on the maximum lead-time of all suppliers and a bit to produce a total of 300 watches. Apart from acts of God, there is limited risk for delay.

When the campaign is really successful, the delivery of the unlimited series of watches is based on available production capacity. No use to speculate before the end of the campaign.

Everyone is ready and committed. Recently I checked lead-times and prices with my suppliers again to be sure. The production schedule is up-to-date and the pledge amounts optimized to the latest information.

And then there are the Updates to keep you informed about any developments, good and bad. No risk that I will not inform you in time.

","This project is about sharing my first watch design with you. My drive is to create beautiful quality watches with a twist. Watches that are unlike the usual suspects. That is what I want to offer you, a watch that will attract attention and admiration just by itself because of its attractive looks. A watch that will make you feel standing out from the crowd as well by showing off your good taste.And here it is: The Porthole by Pheidippides Watches.

column1: Now it is time for you to take me up on my presumption that I made that beautiful quality watch with a twist. I have given my best to create nice design details for you to see and feel, details you will not find often. The result is a bold watch for those who want to make a difference.You can find The Porthole onDesign

So I wanted to create a watch looking a bit different, right?Well, somehow inspiration got the better hand of me and I envisioned a watch with a nautical theme. I wanted to use a less likely material for the case and wound up using bronze. It is a softer metal which suffers more from daily use than hardened steel, but it has a lively color and develops a beautiful patina over the years. In due time no watch will look the same.The case is spherical in more than one way. It has a round footprint and a semi-circular side that flows seamlessly into the curve of the glass giving it a smooth haptic feel. The watch slides easily under the cuff of your shirt.The case is linked to the strap by movable lugs. The lugs are made of polished stainless steel giving a nice contrast to the bronze case and matching the polished steel hands.To allow a glance at the watch’s interior, I wanted a see-through back. There was no reason not to include a sapphire window to show the Swiss made movement with a custom rotor. It has 26 jewels and a power reserve of 44 hours. The rotor is finished with beautiful waves.To make the watch face resemble the sea, the dial is glossy blue lacquered. The hour markers resemble buoys floating on the sea surface, with dots of Superluminova lighting in the dark.The wide polished steel hands make a bold stand. They have Superluminova on the back making the hands visible at night in their own shadow. The seconds hand looks like a droplet of water. Its only task is to show your watch is still running. Time is essential but should not rule us to the second, right?The hands and hour markers have matching dimensions, so when the minute hand moves over a marker it will cover it precisely and the Superluminova will glow through the matching hole.To finish the watch’s design I created a crown that echoes the shape of the case. The custom made crown even has a rim echoing the case-glass transition.The watch and buckle are held together by a brown genuine leather strap. As an alternative I also selected a black silicone strap which will take to a swim much more gracefully.Prototyping

And now for the other fun part, creating prototypes.Being unemployed at the time with a nice inheritance, I have been able to invest time and money in developing prototypes. I am working together with a German workshop to do the technical development and production of the custom made cases. I prefer Swiss suppliers for the watch’s intestines.July last year I got that brainwave and since then I took my time to refine the drawings again and again until every detail was to my liking. In December the (technical) drawings were finished and the German guys could start their magic at the CNC machine working the case.Since September I have been busy selecting Swiss suppliers for the parts and by February this year all parts materialized just the way I designed them. Tolerances are nice but some of the design features require accuracy to the one hundredth of a millimeter. We recently finished fine-tuning the case to the actual prototype parts I received to meet those requirements.The result is a watch just as I'd envisioned, a beautifully executed quality watch for you to enjoy. It took some time and perseverance, but I have been able to bring it all together. Holding that first prototype is a great feeling. A feeling I could convey to you when you decide to pledge for The Porthole.Main features:
Polished bronze case and screw-in see-through back, 42mm in diameter and 12.3mm thick
Polished stainless steel movable lugs, stretched out lug-to-lug size is 55mm, 22mm wide
Polished nickel hands and hour markers filled with C5 Superluminova
Movement: STP5-15 by Swiss Technology Production, 44 hours reserve, 26 jewels
French brown genuine leather or black silicone strap, tapered, size 22/20mm

As I said in the introduction, the bronze will develop a patina over time. This process will take months if not years. If you can't wait that long, you can accelerate it by putting the watch case inside a sealbag together with a crushed boiled egg. Then it happens over night. Here you can see the result of the eggsperiment. You can undo by emerging the watch into cola :-).Production

Now it is time for the next step: releasing the watch into the world of aficionados such as yourself. The goal of this Indiegogo campaign is to raise enough funds to produce at least a series of 300 watches. And hopefully more... The campaign's target is set for a minimum of 50 watches.Glasses, hands, dials and movements are supplied from Switzerland. I found a good quality-to-price ratio for each part. Because of its special shape, the case is custom build in a German workshop with experience in making jewelry. Case and back are polished as a pair for the smoothest possible transition. Nevertheless they make the case for a fair price.A watchmaker colleague and myself will assemble the watches in this German workshop. That allows for an important benefit: I will be on top of the assembly process all the time, so there is continuous in-line Quality Assurance and speedy response to aberrations. In my humble opinion better than doing postproduction Quality Control on finished watches with the risk of having to rework faulty ones from scratch.In the end I think I made it happen: a beautiful European built quality watch with a fair price tag. By backing my project you will help me to fulfill my dream of creating and sharing my watch. For that gesture I will be very grateful.Perks

The limited series of The Porthole comes in one execution. The colors and materials are pretty well balanced and match the nautical theme wonderfully. Just as I envisioned it. Or... check the stretch goals.The limited edition watches will be numbered ""Ixxx of I300"" to show their Indiegogo origin. If we don't reach 300, then the actual number of pledges will determine the limited series length. After that the watches will be numbered sequentially.You will have a choice of 2 straps: brown leather or black silicone. You can let me know your selection during a survey after the project has been successfully funded.The shadowing effect of the luminova on the back of the hands is less strong on a glossy dial. Although the glossy finish resembles the sea surface as intended, a pearl finish will scatter the light better. You can choose your glossy or pearl finish for the dial in the post-campaign survey.Stretch target #1:I designed a custom made pin-buckle for the strap. The buckle echoes the shape of the lugs to form a perfect match with the watch. The standard pin-buckle is swapped with this buckle when we reach € 60,000.Stretch target #2:I will include a folding buckle with every watch when we reach € 120,000.Stretch target #3:I will include both straps with every watch when we reach € 180,000.Stretch target #4:reaching € 240,000 will open up a range of alternative materials and colors. I will offer the case in polished steel, the lugs in bronze and a green dial in both finishes. I might even offer a full brass version (case, lugs, dial, hands, markers). You will be offered a choice of metals and dial color in the post-campaign survey. Any combination is possible.Your watch has a warranty of 1 year starting on the first day of the month following the month of shipment. After that you can have your watch serviced at your local watchmaker. Spare parts will be available of course.Your pledge goes a long way on Indiegogo. Like any entrepreneur I would like to see my watches on the shelves of shops one day. By then the price will have tripled easily. Distribution channels and shops will take their share in revenue. So this is your chance to be among the first owners of a great watch for an affordable offer.N.B. for EU residents only: I have to pay your VAT for you. Your VAT is included in the shipping cost as a single amount when you pledge. So don't be startled when you see the shipping cost: it is € 12 shipping + 21% VAT.

Right after the campaign I will order all parts. It will take anywhere between 3 and 5 month for these orders to fulfill. Most parts will take not much longer than 3 months, but the movements will take up to 4. And we need to account for summer closure of factories. As soon as parts arrive, we will check their quality, so we can act as soon as possible when necessary.We will start by mounting the glasses, which can be done before the movements arrive, gaining some time. We will also start shipping out the first watches made as soon as possible. We don’t have to wait to send you your perks until all watches are assembled.We will explore the possibility of having the parts shipped to us in a series of smaller batches. This will enable us to start assembling the watches earlier. There is room for a bit of slack, but we should all be realistic about unforeseen delays. We will do our best to ship your perk on time for the Gift season.Press kitYou can find a press kit here.Risks & Challenges

0,"

 

 

We are an independent designer brand based in NY.

Our passion for unique and minimal designs led us to create leather handbags that provide more than one option, and we came up with the idea of foldable and transformable bags.

We launched our brand in 2016 with our 1st transformable bag, the Hana shoulder, and now we are excited to introduce our new collection.

 

The Rei bag transforms from a stylish shoulder bag to a messenger bag by simply closing zippers on the front and the back side.
column2: >THE REI - SHOULDER BAG VERSION
column4: >THE REI - MESSENGER BAG VERSION
column5:
> 

The Mari tote transforms from a standard tote, to a fun geometric tote, and to a hands-free backpack with a few simple manipulations.

column1: With an eye for high quality, all the leather we use is carefully selected and sourced from Italy and Spain.
column2:
>THE NORA BACKPACK

We only partner with manufacturers that maintain a high level of craftsmanship and subscribe to ethical practices.

Over the last 2 years we’ve met with factories in different countries, including the US, South Korea and Vietnam, and tested to compare which is the right fit for our products. We decided on a manufacturer in Vietnam who produces high quality leather handbags for European and US brands. 

 

 

Since leather is natural product, there are some parts that aren’t normally usable due to its irregular shape. The industry standard wastage of leather ranges from 20% - 50%, depending on the size of the leather piece.

We tried to find a solution to this wasteful practice, and came up with an idea to make use of the scraps. After cutting the leather, all scrap pieces from the bags are gathered and reused to create the pouches.
column3: >THE CLOUD POUCH IS MADE OF SCRAP LEATHER PIECES FROM THE CLOUD BAG
column7: >
column19: >THE REI - SHOULDER BAG VERSION
column22: >THE REI - MESSENGER BAG VERSION​
column26:
> 

 - The Rei bag transforms from a stylish shoulder bag to a messenger bag by simply closing zippers on the front and the back side.

column1: • Available in Ocean Blue, Black, Light Grey, Tan
• Shoulder bag dimension: 14.5""W x 13.5""H x 4.5""D (37cm x 34.2cm x 11.5cm) with 9"" (23cm) shoulder drop
• Messenger Bag dimension: 14.5""W x 11""H x 4.5""D (37cm x 28cm x 11.5cm)
• Black metal clips and d-rings for long shoulder strap attachment
• Interior: Cotton twill lining with a zipper pocket
• Fits a 13"" laptop or tablet and your essentials
- The Nora backpack can be worn as a backpack and a tote by adjusting the strap length.
• Available in Ocean Blue, Black, Light Grey, Tan
• Black metal sliders and metal snaps for backpack strap adjustment
• Interior: Cotton twill lining with a padded laptop/ tablet pocket and 2 slip pockets for small items
• Fits a 13"" laptop or tablet and your essentials

column18:
> 

 - Three bags in One! The Mari tote transforms from a standard tote shape to a geometric tote, and finally to a backpack.

column1: • Available in Burgundy, Misty Sky, Fire Red, Black
• Matt gunmetal clip and a d-ring for the backpack closure
• 2 sets of snaps in black oxide finish for the main closure
• Interior: Unlined with a cotton twill zipper pocket

column17:
> 

 - The Cloud bag can be worn short and long on the body. Simply adjust the strap so the bag converts to a sling bag, crossbody, or underarm shoulder bag.

column1: • Available in Burgundy, Misty Sky, Fire Red, Black
• Body dimension: 9.5""W x 7""H x 2 1/4""D (24.2 cm x 17.8 cm x 5.7 cm)
• Black metal buckle for the strap adjustment
• Interior: Cotton twill lining with a zipper pocket
• It fits a 7.5"" long wallet, phone and other small items

column16: >- The Cloud pouch is created from the scrap leather pieces from cutting the Cloud crossbody bags. Since the leather is upcycled, the cost of the leather is not added to the price.

column1: • Available in Burgundy, Misty Sky, Fire Red, Black
• March 23rd - March 29th : Send backer surveys for color selections

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Working in the industry as a designer for 19 years, I've encountered numerous obstacles during the production stage, and there's always a challenge that suppliers do not fulfill orders on time. I am working with a professional factory and suppliers that have years of experience. Please be assured that I am an experienced designer with the knowledge and resources to resolve issues that may occur, and I will try to avoid any delays. 
However if there are any unforeseen circumstances that delay the work, I will always keep open and honest communication with all my backers!

Duty/VAT charges: If you live outside of the US, you will be responsible for any applicable duty/VAT charges.

We have had 2 successful Kickstarter campaigns and now we have been at the design table again to make a new Titanium collection. This time a Wayfarer-Style, that fits both classy style and Sports. We are proud to present this new prototype with you and hope you like it as much as we do.

 

We are keeping our track that we will beat the market prices while using the best materials possible. Reliable glasses that do not break and are not absurdly overpriced. Why buy new glasses all the time when you can have a pair that continues to last through all occasions you expose them to. 

Titanium is the perfect material for sunglasses. High strength-to-weight-ratio. Extreme temperature and corrosion resistance makes it to a obvious choice. We have added some carbon insertion on the sides from the same material as our Fibrous glasses. The ear rest made of rubber to make them a soft and pleasant to wear. and to make them fit perfectly we have German OBE hinges to complete the reliability as we had on the Aviator Collection.

We found these boxes a while back and haven't found anything that beats those in feeling and looks. Every pair of our Titan sunglasses comes with an exclusive PU leather box that easily can be folded so it does't take up any space when you have your shades on!

The lenses might just be the most important part of a pair of sunglasses. And what good would they do if they didn't match the high quality of the titanium frames? We have searched long and hard to find the right lenses and are proud to present the optics for our Titans. First off we use 7 layer polarized lenses that effectively reduces glare, eliminating dazzling light reflection and scattered light which makes the vision more soft and clear. The Polaroid lenses have seven layers composite materials with UV400 ultraviolet ray standard. This means that they block all wavelengths of light from 400 nm, which covers all of the UV spectrum. The first and last layer features a clear and durable scratch-resistant layer to avoid any damage you expose them to.

Besides the quality of the lenses we wanted to heighten the diversity so that you can give your Titans a more personalized look. The solution was to design them so that you safely and easily can change the lenses yourself. With bunch different colors of polarized lenses you can give your Titans a new look every day of the week!

column6: >The O-Rings, a toy for every kid!

column1: At Increment we make toys for all kids, regardless of age or ability.
Our first toy is the O-Rings: sensory learning playthings that foster developmental skills. We need your help to bring them to market.

All kids learn through play, absorbing information through their senses. When they climb, build, push, pull, throw they are gaining the problem solving skills and interpersonal skills that we adults use in daily life.

Kids lose themselves in imaginative play, when they are engaging with new things and exploring the world around them ­ they are learning, but to them it is simply playing. Our toys foster open-ended play to build creativity in all kids.

column5: />
column8: />

column6: />

column5: />

column1:
We are Maeve And Cynthia, Industrial Designers and Co-Founders of Increment. We met at Rhode Island School of Design and bonded over our shared interests in collaboration, accessibility, education, health, and 

play. We decided to form Increment after graduation,­ so we could make our projects a reality.
We believe that to create successful toys, you must play through your work, so that's what we do.

column2: >We began designing accessible toys together in our senior at RISD. After working together for a semester, we decided to collaborate on our degree project to delve into the world of inclusive learning.

column1: Physical prototypes allow us to physically communicate the details of our concepts to the specialists we work with
As designers, we focus on creating products that are responsive to our users needs through research and collaboration.

We worked with educators, specialists, parents, and kids, to understand what unmet needs existed for children both in play and development. We discovered that many toys and tools have to be adapted to be used by a child with disabilities, and saw an opportunity to create a product that could fulfill many roles in many environments.

Along the way, we met Megan, who became our inspiration. Megan is blind and has other impairments including low muscle control, which severely affects her balance. Her parents told us that she didn’t like many toys and her teachers said that it was difficult to find toys that Megan could use with her friends. They challenged us to create a good looking toy that could be used at home, in school, and in therapy by any kid, regardless of ability, and the O-Rings came to life!
Join us in making the toy industry more accessible, more social, and more creative!
We have two other toys in development, but we need your help to launch our first product in what we want to build as an entire line of inclusive playthings.
Our goal of $30,000 will go straight to producing the first 150 sets of O-Rings.

It is important that our toys be safe and durable. The O-Rings are made with high-quality, certified non-toxic materials that are safe for use in schools. They are also manufactured in the U.S. This is why the price per set is so high, they are built to last.

What Will Change:

The textures and colors might change slightly, but they will remain high-quality materials and the same basic textures.
Our pattern has changed, and every seam with be double-stitched to be more uniform and prevent any spilled liquids or moisture into the interior.

column4:
/>

We have partnered up with The Grommet, a product launch platform, for an exclusive launch of the O-Rings in their online marketplace once our toys are in production.

column1: Right now, we can only ship the O-Rings within the U.S. If you are outside of the U.S., and want to pre-order a set, send us an email and we will be in touch and create a customized option for you. The two smallest options are available for international shipping (add $5.95). You can also choose to donate a set, or collaborate with us in creating our next product.
If you have any questions or would like to get in touch with us, you can shoot us an email at hi [at] incrementstudios [dot] com
Join our mailing list through our website, like us on Facebook, and follow us on Twitter!
Please do not contact us with unsolicited services or offers (here's looking at you, crowdfunding marketing/PR ""boosters"").

As designers, we focus on creating products that are responsive to our users needs through research and collaboration.

We worked with educators, specialists, parents, and kids, to understand what unmet needs existed for children both in play and development. We discovered that many toys and tools have to be adapted to be used by a child with disabilities, and saw an opportunity to create a product that could fulfill many roles in many environments.

Along the way, we met Megan, who became our inspiration. Megan is blind and has other impairments including low muscle control, which severely affects her balance. Her parents told us that she didn’t like many toys and her teachers said that it was difficult to find toys that Megan could use with her friends. They challenged us to create a good looking toy that could be used at home, in school, and in therapy by any kid, regardless of ability, and the O-Rings came to life!
Join us in making the toy industry more accessible, more social, and more creative!
We have two other toys in development, but we need your help to launch our first product in what we want to build as an entire line of inclusive playthings.
Our goal of $30,000 will go straight to producing the first 150 sets of O-Rings.

It is important that our toys be safe and durable. The O-Rings are made with high-quality, certified non-toxic materials that are safe for use in schools. They are also manufactured in the U.S. This is why the price per set is so high, they are built to last.
What Will Change:The textures and colors might change slightly, but they will remain high-quality materials and the same basic textures.
Our pattern has changed, and every seam with be double-stitched to be more uniform and prevent any spilled liquids or moisture into the interior.
We have partnered up with The Grommet, a product launch platform, for an exclusive launch of the O-Rings in their online marketplace once our toys are in production.

Right now, we can only ship the O-Rings within the U.S. If you are outside of the U.S., and want to pre-order a set, send us an email and we will be in touch and create a customized option for you. The two smallest options are available for international shipping (add $5.95). You can also choose to donate a set, or collaborate with us in creating our next product.
If you have any questions or would like to get in touch with us, you can shoot us an email at hi [at] incrementstudios [dot] com
Join our mailing list through our website, like us on Facebook, and follow us on Twitter!
Please do not contact us with unsolicited services or offers (here's looking at you, crowdfunding marketing/PR ""boosters"").",20.0,1,"1 Campaign

column6: >We’re here to introduce the Elite Series by Hang Loose Optics
column7:
>Polarized sunglasses made from innovative and high quality materials, ready to take with you on your next adventure. 


Spending a lot of time on and around the water in the summer and in the snow during the winter, we have spent top dollar for eyewear over the years. During these trips it is not uncommon to damage or break your sunglasses, wether it is caused by a complete whipe out in the snow or just plain bad luck walking on the beach. This hurts the wallet.
column8:
>

This had to be changed, and thats why we are here. We were convinced that it had to be possible to offer high quality polarized shades, which you can wear without having to worry about dropping or scratching them, at an affordable price. Glasses that actually protect the eyes and look awesome at the same time. For the last 4 months we have been:

column2: >Our lenses are constructed out of polycarbonate. This material is known for its extreme durability (scratch &amp
column3:
impact resistant) Besides that, the polarized layer together with the additional UV filter completely filters out all ultraviolet A/B/400 rays and reduces any glare plus enhances optical clarity. 



Our frames are constructed out of thermoplastic polyamide. This is a material that can be put under extreme pressure and still return to its original shape. The increased flexibility and strength can withstand more abuse and sit comfortably on any face.

column1: Other major advantages over normal frame materials are:
Custom machined high quality metal logo with MiM (metal injection moulding)
Fully frame integrated hinges for extra strength, rigidity and consistent tension when opening and closing the shades
We have come a long way and we’re almost ready to start production. All we need now is your support !
column4: >In return for your support, we are going to send you the first production run of the Elite Series sunglasses.
column5: >With every pair of sunglasses, a custom 100% eco-friendly pouch is included. Free shipping is included for the Netherlands and Belgium. All other countries please add $6. At the end of our campaign you will receive a survey so you can specify which color you want.
column6: >Soul Surfers Foundation (SSF) has been established in May 2008 by a group of passionate surfers and world travellers who realised there were few opportunities for the children and youth in the coastal communities they were visiting.

column1: Rather than channelling their efforts into a single project, they began to explore the wider potential and power of the internet to reach a greater motivated audience, create networks and raise funds.
They do fundraising activities to create awareness amongst the world’s surfers and to raise funds for development projects in coastal communities.

For every backer, we will donate 1USD to the Soul Surfers Foundation, when the campaign is successfully funded.

This is a material that can be put under extreme pressure and still return to its original shape. The increased flexibility and strength can withstand more abuse and sit comfortably on any face.
Other major advantages over normal frame materials are:
Custom machined high quality metal logo with MiM (metal injection moulding)
Fully frame integrated hinges for extra strength, rigidity and consistent tension when opening and closing the shades

We have come a long way and we’re almost ready to start production. All we need now is your support ! In return for your support, we are going to send you the first production run of the Elite Series sunglasses. With every pair of sunglasses, a custom 100% eco-friendly pouch is included. Free shipping is included for the Netherlands and Belgium. All other countries please add $6. At the end of our campaign you will receive a survey so you can specify which color you want. Soul Surfers Foundation (SSF) has been established in May 2008 by a group of passionate surfers and world travellers who realised there were few opportunities for the children and youth in the coastal communities they were visiting.

Rather than channelling their efforts into a single project, they began to explore the wider potential and power of the internet to reach a greater motivated audience, create networks and raise funds.

This page is for the mantis magician design. If you would like to order one of the other four limited edition designs, click the link below:
Leafy Seadragon   Humpback Whale  Octo-Photographer  Giant Australian Cuttlefish

Illustrator Jo Brown produces incredible artworks that showcase animal life from around the world. We have been following Jo Brown's artworks since we came across her unique style of drawings several years ago. Recently we reached out to Jo with the idea of producing new artworks based on underwater photographs of our favourite ocean animals from around the world.

Jo has created some incredible concept pieces that we are hoping to print in a limited production of 25 t-shirts through this campaign. If successful, we will continue to work with Jo to think up and release new designs.

Lets share Jo's artwork with the world and show people our passion for marine life whilst we're at it. Art isn't only to be admired on gallery walls - why not wear beautiful art on a hand printed, eco-friendly T-shirt!

We've found a supplier of organic cotton T-shirts (free of plastic micro-fibres) produced using responsible social practices and renewable energy. The 'Earth Positive' T-shirts will be hand screen printed in Bristol, UK and shipped directly to you using as little plastic packaging as we can.
How do I make sure that  I get the right size and colour?
At the end of the campaign we'll send you a survey asking for which cut (M/F), colour and size combination you would like. We will then send them out
Why run an Indiegogo campaign for T-shirts - why not do a bulk print and sell them individually?

Consumer clothing produces an incredible amount of waste, some of which ends up in our oceans. The global average consumption of textiles is around 13kg per person, per year. Along the production chain there can be negative effects from agricultural practices, emissions of chemicals and plastic micro-fibres, and poor working conditions in factories. It sounds unthinkable, but a large portion of the budget fashion produced every year never ends up being worn before it enters landfill.

column2: >10,000 discarded clothing items in Hugh’s War on Waste

column1: We want to ensure that any T-shirts we get made have as positive an impact on the people and environment as possible. For this to work, we need them all to go on to a happy new owner, with none left unworn or discarded as 'fashion waste'. When they can be worn no longer we hope they can be donated, mended, up-cycled, or composted rather than discarded into landfill. This campaign can help us make this happen - and if you've read this and become a supporter, it's already working!
What if you get more than 25 T-shirt orders? Will you run out?

No, we won't run out - we won't take your money or print the shirts if we don't get 25 orders, but we would love to print more. If you're a supporter and we make or exceed our goal, you won't miss out on a shirt.

Most of the funding will go towards actually purchasing and printing the T-shirts, since this is a minimum run. About 30% of each shirt sale will go towards collaborating on the next set of commissioned artworks with Jo Brown.

If we exceed our initial goal of funding 25 shirts, the cost of printing begins to decrease. If we get more than 25 orders, we'll donate 2.5% of the proceeds to Oceana, a charity which campaigns for global Ocean Conservation at a community level. If we pass 100 shirts we will increase this to 5%
column3: for 200 shirts, 10%, and so on to a maximum of 20% of the overall funding.

column1: The shirts look awesome, I want to support the campaign, what size should I order?

Here's the sizing guide direct from the t-shirt supplier. We'll hopefully get some samples soon, so we can give you a guide against real people. Please note that due to the small print run and screen-printing method, the size of the printed artwork will not scale to the size of the shirt.

To view the octopus t-shirt campaign click here.

To view the leafy seadragon t-shirt campaign click here 

To view the cuttlefish t-shirt campaign click here

To view the humpback whale t-shirt campaign click here

Why do you need this watch?

This is the WW2 watch for the collector who treasures his WW2 era watch, but needs a watch with the same comfortable feel that he can wear every day!

We make these to be used, as was intended all those years ago, wherever your outdoor duties may take you, while your pride and joy is protected somewhere else.

The price for a decent example of a “Dirty Dozen” WWW watch, or any of the twenty earlier ATP watches, is so high that the collector can only wear one on a daily basis with trepidation.

Why risk damaging your collectable WWW or ATP watch, when you can wear one of our watches to eliminate the risk.
column2:
>

And, if you keep your collectable watch in a safe, you cannot share your pleasure in wearing it with others.
column3:
>

Our watches are not designed to be inspired exclusive oversized Swiss masterpieces
column4:
they do not combine military tradition with Italian design and contemporary fashion.   They are a practical assembly of key WW2 era design elements for affordable and enjoyable daily use.

If our A.F.0210. watch is damaged during wear, it is priced so that you can easily purchase another watch, knowing that your treasured WW2 era watch is unharmed.

Our Supporters

We commenced production of our A.F.0210.® strap for WW2 era military watch collectors in September 2018.     Why?  The original AF0210 strap was a contemporary partner for WWW watches, and was used by the military for 30 years, but is virtually impossible to find.

Full details of the history of the strap, and our remanufacturing journey can be found at :

http://af0210strap.com

One outcome of producing the faithful reproduction A.F.0210.® strap has been the realisation that collectors are reluctant to wear rapidly appreciating collectible watches on a daily basis.   Yet the strap is so comfortable to wear, this is hard to resist.

There is a desire for an affordable 36mm WW2 era watch that is wearable and comfortable on the wrist, which can be used in all circumstances.

We have sought to produce a white dial watch to emulate the ATP watch of 1939, and a black dial watch to emulate the design of the WWW watch of 1945.   

These will be supplied with the contemporary A.F.0210.® strap, to replicate the WW2 feel when wearing the watch.

 

The Design
column5:
>

 

The design of our watch was completed by others in 1939.   Those responsible had not yet dreamed up the words Mil. Spec.  They had not seen gauges on an instrument panel to emulate. But, they were responsible for starting a tradition.  We have not sought to improve it.  We have merely used their design elements.

With the rapid expansion of the British Army in 1939, the MoD ordered military watches from various Swiss manufacturers.  The design of this, the ATP watch, was simply a 32mm metal cased white dial watch, with a railroad track minute marker chapter ring, very legible numbers, syringe hands, a sub seconds dial at 6 o'clock, and fixed bars.

The manufacturers produced 20 similar designs which they believed met the MoD requirements.  Shown below, on A.F.0210.® straps are 4 of the 20 ATP designs by  Reconvilier, Lemania, Ebel and Enicar, most with a sterile dial, clockwise from top left.
column6:
>

The various ATP watches on A.F.0210®. straps can be seen at :

http://af0210strap.com/index.php/the-atp-watch-on-an-a-f-0210-strap/

We have taken these manufacturers design themes and have emulated the design in a 36mm diameter stainless steel cased watch
column7:
our white, everyday, ATP A.F.0210. watch.     This has a sterile dial. 

It is shown middle below with 3 ATP watches, and a US military A-11 watch of the same era.
column8:
>  

We could have pitched the A.F.0210. watch as a reinterpretation of the classic ATP watch, restyled using state of the art materials, updated with a modern movement from a leading Swiss watch movement maker, making a watch with low maintenance and giving it exceptional reliability, resulting in a truly timeless watch.     But, it is actually an affordable ATP type watch with a Japanese quartz movement, that will be comfortable to wear, will not cause despair if damaged, and will reliably tell you the time when you use it.

The Generals got together again in 1944 and revised the ATP design.
column9:
>

They could not do much better than reinforce the tradition they had started.   But, based on 4 years if experience, the white dial had proved to be unsatisfactory, and the watch was also a little small.

So, they increased the diameter to 36mm, and made the dial black, incorporated both the manufacturers signature and a pheon on the dial, thus creating the WWW watch - Watch, Wrist, Waterproof.   

12 manufacturers produced WWW watches in 1945 which they believed met the MoD requirements.  The hands and the sub seconds dials varied a little more in style than did the ATP designs.   The four example WWW watches below are signed, with a pheon, and are on A.F.0210.® straps.
column11:
> 

The complete set of watches on A.F.0210.® straps can be seen at : 

https://thespringbar.com/blogs/guides/what-does-one-of-the-dirty-dozen-look-like-on-an-a-f-0210-strap

We have taken WWW watch design elements and have emulated the design in a 36mm diameter stainless steel cased watch, as our black, everyday, WWW A.F.0210. watch.     This is shown below in a gun metal case, but the production model will be polished silver.
column12:
>

This is not an over the top campaign, pretending to reinvent the military watch as a modern interpretation with classical features.  This is a WWW type watch, a pleasure to wear on the comfortable A.F.0210.® strap, that will tell you the time when you use it daily.

column1:
This was also designed by the generals as a jungle warfare strap in late 1944.

The strap is the AF0210®, a faithful remanufacture of the WW2 strap, which fits any wrist.
column5:
> 
The strap is not hand tooled calf leather from an Italian workshop, but merely an authentic reproduction of a WW2 strap in cotton.
 
The original strap complements the WW2 watches, and is very comfortable to wear.
 
The strap length can be 250mm as was the original WW2 watch strap, or a 270mm long strap.
 
   

The Specification

column1:
Timeline

 

As you can see from the video below, we have the strap in production, and are at prototype stage with both the white ATP A.F.0210. watch, and the black WWW A.F.0210. watch.

We will convert to production in our crowdfunding as we progress.

 

Packaging
column3:
>

This watch does not come in a custom wooden crate, or a specially made tin box with dog tags.

We simply ship it in the oil paper package as used in 1945, with the later NATO type numbering.
column7:
>

 

 

Funding

We have funded the prototype watch production, and already have a history of producing and selling the A.F.0210.® strap.

The feedback from the A.F.0210.® strap supporters, has resulted in the A.F.0210. watch prototypes, and this campaign.

We need your commitment as a crowd funding supporter to determine your dial colour preference, and our initial level of production.

 

Risks and challenges

We know from our strap production experience that creating and delivering a product is a complicated process and often comes with unexpected hiccups.

Just like the generals from 1939 onwards, we are prepared and can react to any situation.

We will provide regular updates and photographs as often as possible, for example when the watch cases are finished, when the dials are printed, and during final assembly.

Taxes

The watches will be shipped as a tracked package to your nominated address.

You will be responsible for any customs duties and taxes.

Dearest of loyal meme Queens and Kings,

We are currently totally prepared to make the first order of Pepe masks for you guys! The thing(s) we need first, are to cover our tooling and initial production costs. Which we can just do with the $7000 we're asking for. What you'll get in exchange is our revolutionary, life-shattering product! (If we don't achieve our goal, all contributors will receive a full refund)

 

If we succeed in getting the first $7000, we will immediately place the order for 500 masks and get them on their way (sea shipping from Asia - approx 4-6 weeks to our doorstep - will have a better estimate when we have our order placed &
column2:
will update here). From there, we will begin shipping to all of you guys as soon as possible! 


Our first 50 customers will receive their Pepe Mask at a discount, shipped first, as well as a card indicating their Production Serial #! You will have one of the very first 50 off of the production line!!!

The rest of the masks bought on Indiegogo will be at a discount to the planned retail rate of $30, so buy yours before we run out!

 

Whether you end up buying one for yourself or not, please help us out by sharing this with your friends &
column3:
fellow sad ones.

 

Thank you for your interest, and we look forward to hearing from you. Best,

Tim &

What you'll get in exchange is our revolutionary, life-shattering product! (If we don't achieve our goal, all contributors will receive a full refund) If we succeed in getting the first $7000, we will immediately place the order for 500 masks and get them on their way (sea shipping from Asia - approx 4-6 weeks to our doorstep - will have a better estimate when we have our order placed & will update here). Enjoy Good Mood Shoes!

Mood is Good is a new shoe line born from the fashion blog Moodtopia by VerA. The project's mission is to create high quality fashion shoes with a good mood!

I want everybody to feel good, that's why I created a unisex sneakers collection of 6 models, which can be worn by everyone who wants to feel special and wants to be in a good mood. These shoes can help you, just wear them and communicate your good mood with fashion details, style and thrilling color combinations!

When I say this project is for everyone, I mean everyone! Did I say everyone?!

column2: older people (your granny will ask you for a pair of Mood is Good shoes as soon as she sees you wearing it!)

Let's check out the 6 unisex shoes of the 1st collection of Mood is Good:

#01 - GREY &
column7:
FUCHSIA

Tell me...are you already in a good mood? (I bet you do)

What makes this collection of cool sneakers so special?

column1: Unisex (there are both male and female sizes)
100% Made in Italy by Italian genuine shoe artisans...they know how to make shoes better than anyone
Materials: 100% Italian leather, 100% cotton laces (#02, #03, #05 and #06), or leather laces (#01 and #04)
Colorful packaging matched with logo colors of each model
• These shoes make you feel good, comfortable and stylish at the same time.

Are you ready to stand out of the crowd?

Mood is Good shoes can make the difference, whether you choose to wear them for a casual look, or for a more or less formal look. My advice? Pair one of these shoes with formal garments to create a good mood look!
